analyzed: dus las yol bar za ba'o // che ba ni gang lhag par zos pa'o //

analyzed: chung ba ni tshad las chung zhing dman par zos pa ste /

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: mnyam par za ba dang mi mnyam par za ba ste /

original: dus su goms shing gtsang la phan //
analyzed: dus su goms shing gtsang la phan //

analyzed: khrus byas bkres shing dben par gnas //

analyzed: kha gdong lag pa rkang pa bkrus //

analyzed: bla ma byis pa mgron mchod byas //

analyzed: bdag nyid legs par brtags nas ni //

analyzed: ma smad smra 'am yid 'ong smra //

analyzed: skye bo gtsang zhing gus pas stobs //

analyzed: yid 'ong gnyen dang lhan cig bza' // zhes bya ba la ;
translated: One should eat with one’s dear relatives.

analyzed: zas ni dus su bza' zhing longs spyad par bya'o // zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: de yang dus ni bshang dang gci bsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis 'og nas bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: bdag nyid kyis goms shing bsten par gyur na 'phrod par gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: This means that if one becomes accustomed to and relies upon a certain food, it becomes suitable.

analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mi phan pa'o //

analyzed: yang ba ni zas kyi rang bzhin gyis gnod pa med par 'ju bar 'gyur la /

analyzed: ma zhu na yang gnod pa chen po med pa yin no //

analyzed: yang dro bas ni yig 'bye bar byed pa dang / bad kan 'jig par byed pa yin no // ma yengs pa yid la gtod pa ste /
translated: Hot food digests phlegm and destroys phlegm.🔽Undistracted attention is

analyzed: yid gzhan du yengs pa'am /

original: shin tu myur bar za ba'am /
analyzed: shin tu myur bar za ba'am /

analyzed: smra bzhin nam /

analyzed: dgod bzhin du za na /
translated: or while laughing,

analyzed: ro ; / ro drug ldan zhing zhes bya ba ni mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / kha ba dang / tsha ba dang / bska ba'i ro dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Having the six tastes” means having the tastes of sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: mngar bag che zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngar bag che zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Very sweet” means

original: phal cher mngar ba'i shas mang ba'o //
analyzed: phal cher mngar ba'i shas mang ba'o //

translated: Eating very slowly makes it difficult to feel satisfied and content, causes overeating, makes it difficult to digest food, and makes it difficult to digest.

analyzed: khrus byas pa ni gtsang sbra'i cho ga byas pa'o //
translated: “Having bathed” means having performed the ritual of purification.

original: bkres pa ni bru ba tsha ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bkres pa ni bru ba tsha ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Hunger” means being afflicted by the heat of hunger.

original: dben par gnas pa skye bo mang pos ma bskor ba'o //
analyzed: dben par gnas pa skye bo mang pos ma bskor ba'o //
translated: “Staying in a secluded place” means not being surrounded by many people.

analyzed: kha gdong lag pa rkang pa gang dang gang gis bkrus shing dag par byas pa'o //
translated: What is washed and purified by the face, hands, and feet?

analyzed: de bzhin du lha rnams mchod cing rjed pa dang / yi dags la sbyin par bya ba dang / bla ma dang / byis pa dang / mgron du bos pa'am /

original: rtsva la sogs pa sbyin la //
analyzed: rtsva la sogs pa sbyin la //
translated: One should also give grass and so forth to cattle and other animals.

original: bdag nyid legs par brtags nas ni //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par brtags nas ni //
translated: Having well examined oneself,

translated: One who is ill with a chronic or long-standing cough should drink meat broth.

original: drod chung sha zos chang btung bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: drod chung sha zos chang btung bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One who has little digestive heat and has eaten meat should drink wine.

original: me drod chung zhing sha zos pas ni skom du chang btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: me drod chung zhing sha zos pas ni skom du chang btung bar bya'o //
translated: One who has little digestive heat and has eaten meat should drink wine.

original: nad dang sman sogs sbrum bud med //
analyzed: nad dang sman sogs sbrum bud med //
translated: One who is ill, taking medicine, etc., a pregnant woman,

original: zan bcad dka' thub las rnams kyis //
analyzed: zan bcad dka' thub las rnams kyis //
translated: one who is fasting, one who is engaged in austerities,

original: skem dang byis pa rgan po la ;
analyzed: skem dang byis pa rgan po la ;
translated: one who is emaciated, a child, and an old person

original: /'o ma bdud rtsi lta bur phan //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: /'o ma bdud rtsi lta bur phan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are helped by milk, which is like nectar.

original: nad pa la sogs pa nyam chung zhing rmya bar gyur pa'i mi dang / skem pa dang / byis pa dang / rgan po dag la skom du 'o ma btung ba ni bdud rtsi lta bur phan par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nad pa la sogs pa nyam chung zhing rmya bar gyur pa'i mi dang / skem pa dang / byis pa dang / rgan po dag la skom du 'o ma btung ba ni bdud rtsi lta bur phan par byed pa yin no //
translated: One who is ill, etc., a weak person who has become emaciated, one who is emaciated, a child, and an old person are helped by milk, which is like nectar, if they drink it as a beverage.

original: mdor na zos rjes btung ba ni //🔽gang zhig zas dang yon tan gyis //
analyzed: mdor na zos rjes btung ba ni // gang zhig zas dang yon tan gyis //
translated: In brief, a beverage after a meal🔽is recommended in all cases

original: mi mthun mi 'phrod med gyur pa //🔽de ni rnam pa kun tu bsngags //
analyzed: mi mthun mi 'phrod med gyur pa // de ni rnam pa kun tu bsngags //
translated: if it is not incompatible with the food or with the qualities of the person.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In brief, a beverage after a meal is recommended in all cases if it is not incompatible with the food or with the qualities of the person.

original: mdor bsdu na zas kyi rjes la skom du btung bar bya ba ni gang zhig zas dang mi 'dra zhing /🔽de dang rang bzhin mi mthun par gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na zas kyi rjes la skom du btung bar bya ba ni gang zhig zas dang mi 'dra zhing / de dang rang bzhin mi mthun par gyur pa de ni /
translated: In brief, after eating food, one should drink a beverage that is not similar to the food.🔽That which is not similar to the food and is not of the same nature as the food

original: dus rnam pa kun tu @121a * //
analyzed: dus rnam pa kun tu @121a * //
translated: is always

original: bsngags shing phan bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: bsngags shing phan bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: praiseworthy and beneficial.

original: de yang mi 'phrod pa med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mi 'phrod pa med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it should not be unwholesome.

original: de yang dper na snum pa la rtsub pa dang / rtsub pa la snum pa dang / grang ba la dro ba dang / dro ba la grang ba dang / mngar ba la skyur ba dang / skyur ba la mngar ba dang / mngar ba la kha ba dang /
analyzed: de yang dper na snum pa la rtsub pa dang / rtsub pa la snum pa dang / grang ba la dro ba dang / dro ba la grang ba dang / mngar ba la skyur ba dang / skyur ba la mngar ba dang / mngar ba la kha ba dang /
translated: For example, if food is oily, one should drink a beverage that is rough, if rough, then oily; if cold, then warm; if warm, then cold; if sweet, then sour; if sour, then sweet; if sweet, then bitter;

original: kha ba la mngar ba'o //
analyzed: kha ba la mngar ba'o //
translated: if bitter, then sweet.

original: de lta na ni 'o ma las g-yos byas pa'i zas dang / 'o ma las gyur pa rnams la skom du rang sgyur gyi rtsa ba mo la sogs pa btung bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o ma las g-yos byas pa'i zas dang / 'o ma las gyur pa rnams la skom du rang sgyur gyi rtsa ba mo la sogs pa btung bar bya dgos te /
translated: Thus, after eating food that is a derivative of milk, one should drink a beverage that is a derivative of milk, such as buttermilk,

original: zas kyi yon tan las yon tan mi mthun pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: zas kyi yon tan las yon tan mi mthun pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it does not have a property that is incompatible with the food.

original: de'i phyir mi 'phrod pa med pa mi bya ba'i tshig smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'phrod pa med pa mi bya ba'i tshig smos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “without any incompatibility” is mentioned.

original: rtsab mo rang skyur la sogs pa skyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'o ma la sogs pa dang yon tan mi mthun par gyur pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: rtsab mo rang skyur la sogs pa skyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'o ma la sogs pa dang yon tan mi mthun par gyur pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Whatever is sour, such as the sour taste of tamarind, is incompatible with the qualities of milk, etc.

original: de ni mi 'phrod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni mi 'phrod pa yin te /
translated: But that is not incompatibility.

original: 'o ma dang skyur lhan cig bza' ba ni mi 'phrod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o ma dang skyur lhan cig bza' ba ni mi 'phrod pa yin no //
translated: Drinking milk and sour milk together is incompatibility.

original: zhes sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it was previously taught.

original: de bas na gang zas dang skom yon tan mi mthun zhing /
analyzed: de bas na gang zas dang skom yon tan mi mthun zhing /
translated: Therefore, that drink which is food and drink that are incompatible in qualities

original: mtshan nyid tha dad kyang mi 'phrod pa med par gyur ba btung ba de mchog tu bsngags ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad kyang mi 'phrod pa med par gyur ba btung ba de mchog tu bsngags ba yin no //
translated: and have different characteristics, but which are not incompatible, is praised as supreme.

original: da ni skom 'thungs pa'i yon tan smras pa ni /
analyzed: da ni skom 'thungs pa'i yon tan smras pa ni /
translated: Now, the qualities of drinking a beverage are stated:

original: zas rjes skom 'thungs ngoms dang khyab //
analyzed: zas rjes skom 'thungs ngoms dang khyab //
translated: After eating, drinking a beverage satisfies and pervades,

original: stobs 'phel lus ni brtan byed la //
analyzed: stobs 'phel lus ni brtan byed la //
translated: increases strength, and stabilizes the body.🔽It collects food, makes it soft,

original: zas sdud snyi bar 'gyur ba dang // 'drul zhing rnam par 'ju bar 'gyur //
analyzed: zas sdud snyi bar 'gyur ba dang // 'drul zhing rnam par 'ju bar 'gyur //
translated: and causes it to melt and be digested.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: zas kyi rjes skom 'thungs pa ni ngoms shing tshim par byed pa dang / lus khyab cing rdzogs par byed pa dang / gzi ma dangs 'phel zhing brtas bar byed pa dang ; de bzhin du lus brtan par byed pa dang / yan lag brtan zhing mkhregs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: zas kyi rjes skom 'thungs pa ni ngoms shing tshim par byed pa dang / lus khyab cing rdzogs par byed pa dang / gzi ma dangs 'phel zhing brtas bar byed pa dang ; de bzhin du lus brtan par byed pa dang / yan lag brtan zhing mkhregs par byed pa dang /
translated: Drinking after eating satisfies and fills, pervades and completes the body, increases and develops the vital essence, and similarly stabilizes the body, and stabilizes and hardens the limbs.

original: de bzhin du zas kyi tshogs sdud cing gcig tu gnas bar byed la sgong bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du zas kyi tshogs sdud cing gcig tu gnas bar byed la sgong bar byed do //
translated: Similarly, it collects the food, makes it stay together and binds it.

original: snyi bar byed pa ni zas bsdus pa de lhod cing snyi bar byed pa dang / zas de nyid 'drul bar byed cing sla bar byed ba dang / de bzhin du rnam par 'ju zhing bde bar 'ju bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyi bar byed pa ni zas bsdus pa de lhod cing snyi bar byed pa dang / zas de nyid 'drul bar byed cing sla bar byed ba dang / de bzhin du rnam par 'ju zhing bde bar 'ju bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Softening makes the collected food soft and pliable, and that food itself becomes liquefied and easy to digest, and similarly it digests and is easily digested.

original: de ni nam tshong yan chad nad //
analyzed: de ni nam tshong yan chad nad //
translated: From the time of drinking, it is a disease.

original: dbugs lud glo rdol cham pa dang // glu len smra mang la chags dang // skad 'gags pa la gnod pa yin //
analyzed: dbugs lud glo rdol cham pa dang // glu len smra mang la chags dang // skad 'gags pa la gnod pa yin //
translated: It is harmful to those who are attached to talking and singing a lot, and to those who have a sore throat.🔽Here, drinking

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽skom 'thungs ba de ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /🔽skom 'thungs ba de ni /
translated: is as follows.

original: @121b nam tshong yan chad kyi nad la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: @121b nam tshong yan chad kyi nad la gnod pa yin no //
translated: It harms the body from the throat upward.

original: de la nam tshong ni mchan khung dang / dpung pa g-yas g-yon gyi bar mtshams la nam tshong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la nam tshong ni mchan khung dang / dpung pa g-yas g-yon gyi bar mtshams la nam tshong zhes bya ste /
translated: The throat is the area between the armpits and the right and left shoulders.

original: de yang lung las /
analyzed: de yang lung las /
translated: A scripture mentions:

original: nam tshong mgo dang ske ba'i rten //
analyzed: nam tshong mgo dang ske ba'i rten //
translated: The throat is the support for the head and neck.

original: mgo 'dzin zhes kyang bshad pa yin //🔽zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mgo 'dzin zhes kyang bshad pa yin // zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It is also called the head holder.

original: de ltar na de yan chad kyi yan lag gi nad la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de yan chad kyi yan lag gi nad la gnod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it harms the body from the throat upward.

original: de bzhin du dbugs mi bde ba dang / lud pa mang ba dang / glo rdol ba dang / cham pas btab pa la yang gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbugs mi bde ba dang / lud pa mang ba dang / glo rdol ba dang / cham pas btab pa la yang gnod pa yin no //
translated: It also harms the body when it is afflicted by asthma, excess phlegm, coughing, and colds.

original: de bzhin du glu len pa dang / smra ba mang po la chags shing yang dang yang du slon pa dang / skad 'gags pa la yang gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du glu len pa dang / smra ba mang po la chags shing yang dang yang du slon pa dang / skad 'gags pa la yang gnod pa yin te /
translated: It also harms the body when one is attached to singing and talking a lot, when one drinks repeatedly, and when one has a sore throat.

original: de rnams kyis ma zhu ba'i gnas la gnod bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de rnams kyis ma zhu ba'i gnas la gnod bar gyur nas /
translated: When those afflict the site of the undigested,

original: lkog mar gyur pa'i zas las byung ba'i snum dang 'dres te /
analyzed: lkog mar gyur pa'i zas las byung ba'i snum dang 'dres te /
translated: they mix with the oil that arises from food in the throat.

original: slon pa la sogs pa'i nad skyed par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: slon pa la sogs pa'i nad skyed par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: and will produce diseases such as dysentery.🔽One should avoid drinking water that is harmful to the body,🔽that is, to one who has a boil, a urinary disease, eye disease,

original: lus las rnag 'dzag gcin nad mig / lkog nad rma yi nad kyis nyen //🔽skom spang / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus las rnag 'dzag gcin nad mig / lkog nad rma yi nad kyis nyen // skom spang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: throat disease, or a wound.

original: gang gi lus la mdze la sogs pas nyen cing rnag 'dzag bar gyur pa dang / de bzhin du gcin nad de /
analyzed: gang gi lus la mdze la sogs pas nyen cing rnag 'dzag bar gyur pa dang / de bzhin du gcin nad de /
translated: One should avoid drinking water that is harmful to the body,🔽that is, to one who has a boil, a urinary disease,

original: lgang pa'i nad yod pa dang / mig na ba dang / lkog ma'i nad na ba dang / rma'i nad kyis nyen cing gnod par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lgang pa'i nad yod pa dang / mig na ba dang / lkog ma'i nad na ba dang / rma'i nad kyis nyen cing gnod par gyur pa ste /
translated: eye disease, throat disease, or a wound.🔽All of them should avoid drinking water.

original: de dag thams cad kyis skom spang zhing dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis skom spang zhing dor bar bya'o //
translated: Having drunk water,🔽one should avoid talking, walking, lying down, and so on.

original: kun gyis skom 'thungs nas //🔽mang smra lam zhugs nyal ba spang //
analyzed: kun gyis skom 'thungs nas // mang smra lam zhugs nyal ba spang //
translated: Having drunk water,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: one should avoid talking, walking, lying down, and so on.

original: kun gyis zhes bya ba nad med pa'am /
analyzed: kun gyis zhes bya ba nad med pa'am /
translated: All of them should avoid talking, walking, lying down, and so on.

original: nad dang ldan pa'i mi thams cad kyis kyang skom 'thungs bar gyur pa'i rjes thogs la mang du smra zhing 'don pa dang / lam du zhugs shing 'gro ba dang / nyal zhing gnyid log pa ste /
analyzed: nad dang ldan pa'i mi thams cad kyis kyang skom 'thungs bar gyur pa'i rjes thogs la mang du smra zhing 'don pa dang / lam du zhugs shing 'gro ba dang / nyal zhing gnyid log pa ste /
translated: All sick people should, immediately after drinking, avoid talking and reciting, going on a journey, lying down and sleeping.

original: dus de'i tshe nyid 'phral du bya ba dag spang zhing dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus de'i tshe nyid 'phral du bya ba dag spang zhing dor bar bya'o //
translated: At that time, they should avoid and give up the activities of the moment.

original: zas zos nas ni nyi tshan me //
analyzed: zas zos nas ni nyi tshan me //
translated: After eating, avoid the sun, fire,

original: rta zhon rkyal dang 'degs ba spang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rta zhon rkyal dang 'degs ba spang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: riding, swimming, and lifting.

original: zas zos pa'i rjes thogs nyid la nyi tshan la sogs pa spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: zas zos pa'i rjes thogs nyid la nyi tshan la sogs pa spang bar bya ste /
translated: After eating, avoid the sun and so on.

original: nyi tshan ni nyi ma'i than bas gdungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyi tshan ni nyi ma'i than bas gdungs pa'o //
translated: Sun means being tormented by the heat of the sun.

original: me ni me tsha ba la 'des par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: me ni me tsha ba la 'des par gyur pa'o //
translated: Fire means being burned by the heat of fire.

original: bzhon pa ni rta la sogs pas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bzhon pa ni rta la sogs pas 'gro ba'o //
translated: Riding means going by horse and so on.

original: rkyal ba ni mtsho la sogs bar rkyal ba'o //
analyzed: rkyal ba ni mtsho la sogs bar rkyal ba'o //
translated: Swimming means swimming in lakes and so on.

original: 'degs pa ni gur la sogs pa yul gzhan du bskyod @122a * //
analyzed: 'degs pa ni gur la sogs pa yul gzhan du bskyod @122a * //
translated: Lifting means moving tents and so on to another place.

original: pa ste de spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa ste de spang bar bya'o //
translated: Those should be avoided.

original: zas dang skom yon tan dang ldan pa dang / tshod zin par byas su zin kyang dus ma yin par zos pa dang 'thungs pas lus la gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zas dang skom yon tan dang ldan pa dang / tshod zin par byas su zin kyang dus ma yin par zos pa dang 'thungs pas lus la gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Even if one has eaten and drunk food and drink that is wholesome and has eaten in moderation, if one eats and drinks at the wrong time, that will harm the body.

original: de bas na bshang ba dang / gci ba bsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas de'i dus smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na bshang ba dang / gci ba bsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas de'i dus smras pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the time for eating is stated in the verse beginning, “When the excrement and urine have been eliminated…”

original: bshang dang gci bsal snying la dri med nyes pa lam min bar mi 'gro //
analyzed: bshang dang gci bsal snying la dri med nyes pa lam min bar mi 'gro //
translated: When the excrement and urine have been eliminated, the heart is pure, there is no foul smell, and one does not go to a bad rebirth.

original: sgregs pa dag cing bru ba tsha gyur thur gyi rlung ni tha mal rgyu //
analyzed: sgregs pa dag cing bru ba tsha gyur thur gyi rlung ni tha mal rgyu //
translated: When belching and flatulence are pure, and hunger and thirst are normal, the downward-voiding wind is normal.

original: de bzhin me yi drod bdo dbang po gsal zhing lus kyang rab tu yang //
analyzed: de bzhin me yi drod bdo dbang po gsal zhing lus kyang rab tu yang //
translated: Likewise, when the heat of the digestive fire is strong, the senses are clear, and the body is very light,

original: zas kyi tshod ran cho gar sbyar bzhin za ba de ni dus su 'dod //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: zas kyi tshod ran cho gar sbyar bzhin za ba de ni dus su 'dod // ces bya ba la /
translated: and when one eats food in moderation, in accordance with the rules, that is considered the right time.

original: bshang ba dang gci ba legs par bsal zhing btang ba dang / snying la dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: bshang ba dang gci ba legs par bsal zhing btang ba dang / snying la dri ma med pa ste /
translated: Here, “the excrement and urine have been eliminated” means that they have been well expelled. “The heart is pure” means that there is no foul smell in the heart.

original: sems dangs shing nyam nga ba med pa dang / nyes pa ste rlung la sogs ba lam ma yin pa dag tu log par mi 'gro zhing /
analyzed: sems dangs shing nyam nga ba med pa dang / nyes pa ste rlung la sogs ba lam ma yin pa dag tu log par mi 'gro zhing /
translated: The mind is clear and there is no anxiety, and there is no going astray on paths that are not the path, such as the faults, the winds, and so on.

original: rang gi gnas na gnas pa dang / sgregs pa dag cing dri ma mnam pa med pa dang / bru ba tsha bar gyur cing bkres pas za 'dod par gyur pa dang / thur gyi rlung tha mal par rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi gnas na gnas pa dang / sgregs pa dag cing dri ma mnam pa med pa dang / bru ba tsha bar gyur cing bkres pas za 'dod par gyur pa dang / thur gyi rlung tha mal par rgyu ba ste /
translated: One remains in one’s own place, the belching is pure, and there is no foul smell, and one has an appetite, being hungry and wanting to eat, and the downward winds move normally.

original: thur du 'byung ba'i rlung lugs bzhin 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du pho ba'i me drod bdo zhing shas che ba dang / dbang po gsal zhing rang gi bya ba rnams la 'jug pa gsal ba dang / de bzhin du rang gi lus kyang rab tu yang bar gyur cing bya ba la thogs pa med par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: thur du 'byung ba'i rlung lugs bzhin 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du pho ba'i me drod bdo zhing shas che ba dang / dbang po gsal zhing rang gi bya ba rnams la 'jug pa gsal ba dang / de bzhin du rang gi lus kyang rab tu yang bar gyur cing bya ba la thogs pa med par gyur pa ni /
translated: The downward winds move in the usual way, and likewise the digestive heat is strong and powerful, and the senses are clear and one is clear in engaging in one’s activities, and likewise one’s body is very light and one is unimpeded in one’s activities.

original: zas kyi tshod ran pa'i cho gar sbyar ba ji skad bshad pa de bzhin du za ba de ni zas la spyod pa'i dus yin bar slob dpon dag 'dod cing bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: zas kyi tshod ran pa'i cho gar sbyar ba ji skad bshad pa de bzhin du za ba de ni zas la spyod pa'i dus yin bar slob dpon dag 'dod cing bzhed pa yin no //
translated: The masters assert and maintain that the time for eating is when one eats in accordance with the rules for moderation in food as explained.

original: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i rnam par 'grel pa tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i rnam par 'grel pa tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
translated: The Moonbeams of the Meaning of the Words, a commentary on the essence of the eight branches🔽,

original: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas rnam par sbyar ba las /
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas rnam par sbyar ba las /
translated: composed by the master Candrakīrti.

original: le'u brgyad pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u brgyad pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the eighth chapter.

original: // / de nas sman la sogs pa rnams kyi bye brag shes par bya ba'i le'u bshad bar bya'o ;
analyzed: // / de nas sman la sogs pa rnams kyi bye brag shes par bya ba'i le'u bshad bar bya'o ;
translated: Now, the chapter on the knowledge of the distinctions of medicine and so on should be explained.

original: / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rjes thogs la ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rjes thogs la ste /
translated: “now” means after the previously explained [topics],

original: zas kyi tshod zin par bza' ba'i rjes la /
analyzed: zas kyi tshod zin par bza' ba'i rjes la /
translated: after eating in moderation.

original: sman la sogs pa rnams kyi bye brag shes par bya ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sman la sogs pa rnams kyi bye brag shes par bya ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: The chapter on the knowledge of the distinctions of medicine and so on should be explained.

original: de la sman la sogs ba zhes smos pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni nus @122b pa dang 'ju ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: de la sman la sogs ba zhes smos pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni nus @122b pa dang 'ju ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase and so on in the line medicines and so on includes potency, digestibility, and so on.

original: de rnams bye brag shes bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: de rnams bye brag shes bar bya ba ni /
translated: The line one should understand their distinctions means

original: mtshan nyid khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: that one should understand their characteristics.

original: de shes par 'gyur ba la phan pa'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de shes par 'gyur ba la phan pa'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The line the chapter on what is beneficial to know will be explained means that the chapter will be explained in order to make that known.

original: de gang gi phyir zas dang skom 'di dag ni zas dang / ro dang / nus pa dang / 'ju ba la sogs pa yongs su brtags nas sbyar bar bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de gang gi phyir zas dang skom 'di dag ni zas dang / ro dang / nus pa dang / 'ju ba la sogs pa yongs su brtags nas sbyar bar bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Because of that, the line these foods and drinks should be applied after examining their food, taste, potency, and digestibility, and not otherwise means that these foods and drinks should be applied after examining their food, taste, potency, and digestibility, and not otherwise.

original: de la sman na ma rdzas ni ro la sogs pa las mchog tu gyur pa yin pas dang por bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sman na ma rdzas ni ro la sogs pa las mchog tu gyur pa yin pas dang por bstan pa yin te /
translated: Among them, the line medicines are supreme among tastes and so on means that since substances are supreme among tastes and so on, they are taught first.

original: sman rnams nyid kyi ro la sogs //
analyzed: sman rnams nyid kyi ro la sogs //
translated: Medicines are supreme among tastes and so on.

original: de ni de la brten pas mchog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni de la brten pas mchog / ces bya ba la /
translated: That is supreme among them.

original: sman rnam gnyis ro dang nus pa la sogs pa rnams kyi nang na mchog yin te /
analyzed: sman rnam gnyis ro dang nus pa la sogs pa rnams kyi nang na mchog yin te /
translated: Among the two types of medicines, taste and potency are supreme.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ro la sogs pa de rnams ni sman de la brten cing gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ro la sogs pa de rnams ni sman de la brten cing gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Those tastes, etc. are based on and exist in that medicine.

original: ro la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tshig skyar gnas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ro la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tshig skyar gnas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But they do not exist in the words alone.

original: de bas na de ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni mchog yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the best.

original: de yang 'byung lnga'i bdag nyid can //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang 'byung lnga'i bdag nyid can // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And that is the nature of the five elements.

original: sman de yang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba la sogs pa'i tshul du gnas pa gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: sman de yang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba la sogs pa'i tshul du gnas pa gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: In that, the medicine is the nature of the five elements, existing in the manner of the moving and unmoving results.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnam pa lnga las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnam pa lnga las shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be known from the five kinds of great elements.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa rgyu'i rdzas rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa rgyu'i rdzas rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not from the substantial causes such as space, etc.🔽The five great elements of substantial causes such as space, etc. are the nature of the five great elements.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa rgyu'i rdzas kyi 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa ni so sor rang nyid thob ba'i don du gnas bas 'di ni nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i 'byung ba chen po'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa rgyu'i rdzas kyi 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa ni so sor rang nyid thob ba'i don du gnas bas 'di ni nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i 'byung ba chen po'o //
translated: They exist for the sake of obtaining their own individual results. This is the great element called space.

original: 'di ni sa'i 'byung ba chen po zhes smra bar nus pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni sa'i 'byung ba chen po zhes smra bar nus pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not possible to say that this is the great earth element.

original: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams ni 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid can yin pas na /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams ni 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid can yin pas na /
translated: Earth and so on are the nature of the five great elements.

original: de'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are indicated by the word “that.”

original: de bas na 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can dang gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can dang gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, they are not identical with the nature of the five elements.

original: de nye bar dmigs pa rnam pa lngas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nye bar dmigs pa rnam pa lngas zhes bya ste /
translated: The five ways of apprehending that are as follows.

original: de la de'i dri'i shas che ba gang yin pa de ni sa'i yin la /
analyzed: de la de'i dri'i shas che ba gang yin pa de ni sa'i yin la /
translated: Among them, that which has a predominance of the quality of smell is earth.

original: ro'i shas che ba gang yin pa de ni chu'i yin no //
analyzed: ro'i shas che ba gang yin pa de ni chu'i yin no //
translated: That which has a predominance of the quality of taste is water.

original: gzugs kyi yon tan shas che ba de ni me'i yon tan no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi yon tan shas che ba de ni me'i yon tan no //
translated: That which has a predominance of the quality of form is fire.

original: reg pa'i yon tan shas che ba gang yin pa de ni rlung gi yin no //
analyzed: reg pa'i yon tan shas che ba gang yin pa de ni rlung gi yin no //
translated: That which has a predominance of the quality of touch is wind.

original: sgra'i yon tan shas che ba gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i yon tan shas che ba gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' yin te /
translated: That which has a predominance of the quality of sound is space.

original: gang dang de ni rtag tu 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir /🔽gang @123a * //
analyzed: gang dang de ni rtag tu 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir / gang @123a * //
translated: Because it is always associated with that.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ma smos su zin kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ma smos su zin kyang /
translated: Although the word “that” is not stated,🔽it is understood.

original: bstan pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the teaching is just like that.

original: gal te sman de 'byung ba chen po ldas skyed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te sman de 'byung ba chen po ldas skyed pa yin na /
translated: If that medicine is produced by the four great elements,

original: de 'byung ba chen po gang gis ji ltar byas nas bskyed pa yin /
analyzed: de 'byung ba chen po gang gis ji ltar byas nas bskyed pa yin /
translated: by what and how is it produced by the great elements?

original: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sa la brten te skye ba yin //
analyzed: sa la brten te skye ba yin //
translated: It is produced in dependence on earth.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: sa brten pa'i gnas su byas nas skye ba yin no //
analyzed: sa brten pa'i gnas su byas nas skye ba yin no //
translated: It is produced by making the earth its basis.

original: de ltar nas zhes bya ba'i 'byung ba chen pos rten du byas pa'i dgos pa byas pas na /
analyzed: de ltar nas zhes bya ba'i 'byung ba chen pos rten du byas pa'i dgos pa byas pas na /
translated: Thus, the great element called earth performs the function of being a basis.

original: des bskyed cing bskrun pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des bskyed cing bskrun pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it produces and generates that medicine.🔽Similarly, it is said that it is the source of fire, the source of water,

original: de bzhin du de ni me'i skye gnas zhes bya ba chu'i skye gnas su gyur cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ni me'i skye gnas zhes bya ba chu'i skye gnas su gyur cing /
translated: and the source of wind.

original: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu byed pas na /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu byed pas na /
translated: Since it performs the function of being the cause of production,

original: sman gyi skye gnas ni chu'i yin te /
analyzed: sman gyi skye gnas ni chu'i yin te /
translated: the source of medicine is water.

original: de ltar chu zhes bya ba'i 'byung ba chen pos ro dang ldan par skye gnas kyi dgos ba byas pas des de skyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar chu zhes bya ba'i 'byung ba chen pos ro dang ldan par skye gnas kyi dgos ba byas pas des de skyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the great element called water performs the function of being the source of taste. Therefore, it is said that it produces that medicine.

original: chu ni skye gnas me dang rlung //
analyzed: chu ni skye gnas me dang rlung //
translated: Water is the source of birth, fire and wind.

original: nam mkha' rnams ni tshogs pa las //
analyzed: nam mkha' rnams ni tshogs pa las //
translated: From the assembly of space,

original: de skyes gyur dang khyad par byung //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de skyes gyur dang khyad par byung // zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is born and arises with distinctions.

original: sman de skyes shing byung bar gyur pa dang / rdzogs par 'thon pa de ni me dang rlung dang nam mkha' rnams kyi tshogs pa las skyes bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: sman de skyes shing byung bar gyur pa dang / rdzogs par 'thon pa de ni me dang rlung dang nam mkha' rnams kyi tshogs pa las skyes bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: The arising and birth of that medicine and its emergence and completion is born from the assembly of fire, wind and space.

original: tshogs bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis skyed de /
analyzed: tshogs bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis skyed de /
translated: The assembly generates it through the method of cause and result.

original: des na dper na me ni smin par byed pa nyid kyis dgos pa byed la /
analyzed: des na dper na me ni smin par byed pa nyid kyis dgos pa byed la /
translated: For example, fire performs its function through the act of ripening.

original: rlung ni g-yo 'gul gyis so //
analyzed: rlung ni g-yo 'gul gyis so //
translated: Wind performs its function through movement.

original: nam mkha' ni go 'byed pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni go 'byed pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Space performs its function through the method of providing room.

original: de skyes par gyur ba me dang rlung dang nam mkha' rnams kyi tshogs pa las de skyes par gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gang khyad par du gzhan rnams tshul tha dad cing /
analyzed: de skyes par gyur ba me dang rlung dang nam mkha' rnams kyi tshogs pa las de skyes par gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gang khyad par du gzhan rnams tshul tha dad cing /
translated: Not only is it born from the assembly of fire, wind and space, but also whatever arises with distinctions is born from the assembly of the other different methods.

original: rang bzhin du ma gyur pa'i bar de rnams kyang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' de rnams kyi tshogs ba las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin du ma gyur pa'i bar de rnams kyang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' de rnams kyi tshogs ba las byung ba yin no //
translated: The intermediate state of the embryo, which is not yet transformed into a specific nature, arises from the combination of fire, wind, and space.

original: gal te de ltar sman thams cad dang 'byung ba chen po lnga char gyis bskyed pa yin na /🔽'di ni sa'i 'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar sman thams cad dang 'byung ba chen po lnga char gyis bskyed pa yin na / 'di ni sa'i 'o //
translated: If all medicines are produced by the five great elements,

original: 'di ni chu'i'o zhes ming ci'i phyir dogs shen /
analyzed: 'di ni chu'i'o zhes ming ci'i phyir dogs shen /
translated: why are they called by the names of earth, water, etc.?

original: de'i phyir smras pa ni /🔽ming ni shas che las gyur yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ni / ming ni shas che las gyur yin //
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The name is due to the predominance of the element.🔽The name of a substance is due to the predominance of the element that is its cause.

original: rdzas gang la 'di dag thams cad rgyur gyur pa yin yang /🔽gang gang gi shas che zhing mang bar gyur pa des /
analyzed: rdzas gang la 'di dag thams cad rgyur gyur pa yin yang / gang gang gi shas che zhing mang bar gyur pa des /
translated: Even though all of them are the cause of a substance,

original: de nyid kyi ming du btags pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi ming du btags pa yin te /
translated: the name of the substance is given according to which element is predominant.

original: sa'i shas che ba las skyes pa ni sa'i ming can yin la /
analyzed: sa'i shas che ba las skyes pa ni sa'i ming can yin la /
translated: That which is produced by the predominance of earth is called earth.

original: chu'i shas che ba las skyes pa ni chu'i'o //
analyzed: chu'i shas che ba las skyes pa ni chu'i'o //
translated: That which is produced by the predominance of water is called water.

original: de ltar na sman @123b thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sman @123b thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: Thus all medicines have the nature of the five great elements.

original: de bas 'byung ba 'dus pa las //
analyzed: de bas 'byung ba 'dus pa las //
translated: Therefore, from the combination of the elements,

original: 'byung bas sman ni ro gcig min //
analyzed: 'byung bas sman ni ro gcig min //
translated: Medicines do not have a single taste because of the elements.

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽gang phyir 'byung ba chen po'i tshogs pa rnams las sman rnams 'byung zhing skye ba yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / gang phyir 'byung ba chen po'i tshogs pa rnams las sman rnams 'byung zhing skye ba yin pa de bas na /
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows:

original: sman rnams ni ro gcig kho nar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sman rnams ni ro gcig kho nar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Medicines do not have a single taste because they arise from the collection of the great elements.

original: ro mang zhing tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: ro mang zhing tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Medicines have many different tastes.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'dir 'di ltar gang ro'i rgyu ni 'byung ba chen po gcig po chu nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'di ltar gang ro'i rgyu ni 'byung ba chen po gcig po chu nyid yin no //
translated: Here, one might argue as follows: The cause of taste is the great element of water alone.

original: 'byung ba chen po gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the other great elements,

original: de dag ni ro med pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni ro med pa yin no //
translated: because they are without taste.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang cha 'dra bar 'byung ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang cha 'dra bar 'byung ba yin pas /
translated: Since the effect resembles the cause,

original: gzhan las ro 'byung bar mi rigs so zhes brgal zhing brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan las ro 'byung bar mi rigs so zhes brgal zhing brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: it is not logical for taste to arise from the other elements.

original: gang gi phyir 'byung ba 'dus pa las 'byung zhes bya ba 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'byung ba 'dus pa las 'byung zhes bya ba 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is not a proper objection, because it is taught that medicines arise from the collection of the elements.

original: ci ltar sman 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa las sman 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar sman 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa las sman 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as medicines arise from the collection of the great elements,

original: sman la brten pa'i ro tha dad par gyur pa dag kyang /
analyzed: sman la brten pa'i ro tha dad par gyur pa dag kyang /
translated: The various tastes that are based on medicine

original: 'byung ba 'dus pa nyid las skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byung ba 'dus pa nyid las skye ba yin gyi /
translated: arise from the mere assembly of the elements.

original: yon tan gzhan ltar sman la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gzhan ltar sman la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not depend on the medicine, like other qualities.

original: de bas na 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa nyid ro 'byung bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa nyid ro 'byung bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the mere assembly of the great elements produces taste.

original: 'byung ba chen po kha dog la sogs pa lta bur rdzas gcig pu la rag lus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po kha dog la sogs pa lta bur rdzas gcig pu la rag lus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Taste does not depend on a single substance, like the color of the great elements.

original: de ltar na ro ni 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa las 'byung gi / gcig las ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na ro ni 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa las 'byung gi / gcig las ma yin te /
translated: Thus, taste arises from the mere assembly of the great elements, not from a single one.

original: sman la brten pa'i ro rnams kyi rgyu rnams 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: sman la brten pa'i ro rnams kyi rgyu rnams 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa yin no //
translated: The cause of the tastes that are based on medicine is the mere assembly of the great elements.

original: la la ni yang 'byung ba gnyis shas che ba las sman mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: la la ni yang 'byung ba gnyis shas che ba las sman mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Some say that the taste of medicine such as sweetness is clear when two elements predominate.

original: de yang ro tha dad pa shes par bya ba'i le'u las /🔽mngar ba la sogs ro skye ba //
analyzed: de yang ro tha dad pa shes par bya ba'i le'u las / mngar ba la sogs ro skye ba //
translated: This is stated in the chapter on the knowledge of the different tastes:

original: sa chu me sa chu dang me //
analyzed: sa chu me sa chu dang me //
translated: Sweetness and so on arise from earth, water, fire, and earth, water, and fire.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: and so on.🔽🔽

original: de ltar na ro thams cad ni 'byung ba 'dus pa las 'byung la /
analyzed: de ltar na ro thams cad ni 'byung ba 'dus pa las 'byung la /
translated: Thus, the various tastes are produced from the combination of the elements.

original: de la mang zhing shas che ba las ni 'di ni sman mngar ba'o //🔽'di ni skyur ba la sogs pa'i sman rnams so zhes bya bar gnas kyi /
analyzed: de la mang zhing shas che ba las ni 'di ni sman mngar ba'o // 'di ni skyur ba la sogs pa'i sman rnams so zhes bya bar gnas kyi /
translated: The taste that is most abundant in a given substance is the one that is perceived.🔽The taste that is less abundant is not perceived.

original: mngar ba'i sman de la skyur ba la sogs pa'i zhad du gyur pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngar ba'i sman de la skyur ba la sogs pa'i zhad du gyur pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The taste that is least abundant is not perceived at all.

original: myangs par gyur pa dang nus pa'i dbang gis rdzas rnams la phan tshun du ro du ma snang la /
analyzed: myangs par gyur pa dang nus pa'i dbang gis rdzas rnams la phan tshun du ro du ma snang la /
translated: The various tastes are perceived in a substance by the power of the combination of the elements and by the power of the potency of the substance.

original: chu ni ro mi gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: chu ni ro mi gsal ba yin te /
translated: Water has an indistinct taste.

original: ro drug car dang ldan yang mi gsal zhing mi mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: ro drug car dang ldan yang mi gsal zhing mi mngon pa yin no //
translated: Although it has all six tastes, the tastes are indistinct and not clearly evident.

original: @124a * // de ltar na 'byung ba 'dus pa las sman 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du mngar ba la sogs ba ro rnams kyi yang rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: @124a * // de ltar na 'byung ba 'dus pa las sman 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du mngar ba la sogs ba ro rnams kyi yang rgyu yin pas /
translated: Just as the elements are the cause of the production of a substance, so too are the tastes sweet, etc.

original: ro thams cad ni 'byung ba 'dus pa las byung ba yin zhing ro gsal ba mang bo bshad ba yin no //
analyzed: ro thams cad ni 'byung ba 'dus pa las byung ba yin zhing ro gsal ba mang bo bshad ba yin no //
translated: All tastes arise from the combination of elements, and many clear tastes are explained.

original: de phyir nad kyang nyes gcig min //
analyzed: de phyir nad kyang nyes gcig min //
translated: Therefore, a disease is not just one fault.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is saying:

original: gang gi phyir sman ro sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir nyid kyis na nad ni gcig pu ma yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sman ro sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir nyid kyis na nad ni gcig pu ma yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: Because the medicine has various tastes, it is taught that a disease is not just one thing.

original: de la nad ni nad kyi tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: de la nad ni nad kyi tshogs rnams so //
translated: Here, a disease is the collection of diseases.

original: nyes pa ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
translated: A fault is wind and so forth.

original: de yang ro la brten la ro yang sman la brten te /
analyzed: de yang ro la brten la ro yang sman la brten te /
translated: That also depends on taste, and taste depends on medicine.

original: sman ni 'byung ba chen bo'i bdag nyid can yin pas ro sna tshogs pa nyid la de dang phrad pa las rlung la sogs pa skyed par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: sman ni 'byung ba chen bo'i bdag nyid can yin pas ro sna tshogs pa nyid la de dang phrad pa las rlung la sogs pa skyed par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Since medicine has the nature of the great elements, it has various tastes. From contact with it, wind and so forth are produced.

original: de rnams bskyed pa las ni nad du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de rnams bskyed pa las ni nad du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: From the production of those, a disease occurs.

original: de'i phyir nad kyang nyes pa gcig dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nad kyang nyes pa gcig dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, a disease is not just one fault.

original: nyes pa gsum car ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes pa gsum car ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the case that it has all three faults.

original: 'dir yang mang po nyid yin no zhes shugs kyis sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang mang po nyid yin no zhes shugs kyis sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Here also, many is to be supplied by implication.🔽This is a cold fever.🔽This is a hot fever.🔽This is a bile fever.🔽This is a phlegm fever.

original: 'di ni rlung gi rims so //
analyzed: 'di ni rlung gi rims so //
translated: This is a wind fever.

original: 'di ni mkhris pa'i rims so //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //🔽de la 'dir ro ni gang /
analyzed: 'di ni mkhris pa'i rims so // zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o // de la 'dir ro ni gang /

original: ro rjes ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: ro rjes ni gang zhe na /

original: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ni /

original: de la gsal bar ro zhes bshad //
analyzed: de la gsal bar ro zhes bshad //

analyzed: mi gsal ro rjes mtha' mar ni // cung zad gsal ba dag tu 'ang 'dod //

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /

original: 'byung ba chen po lnga las gyur pa'i sman /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po lnga las gyur pa'i sman /

original: ro thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa de la /
analyzed: ro thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa de la /

analyzed: mngar ba la sogs ba'i ro gang gsal zhing nges pa nyid kyi tshul du shes par 'gyur ba de la ni ro zhes bya bar bshad de / 'di ni mngar ba nyid do //

original: 'di ni skyur ba nyid do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skyur ba nyid do zhes bya'o //

original: ro'i rjes ni mi gsal ba la bya ste /
analyzed: ro'i rjes ni mi gsal ba la bya ste /

original: skyu ru ra la sogs pa gang za ba na /
analyzed: skyu ru ra la sogs pa gang za ba na /

analyzed: lces gsal ba nyid du ma rtogs pa de ni ro rjes zhes bya'o //

original: de ni tha mar zhabs su cung zad ces nyung shas cig ro dang bcas pa gsal ba dag tu'ang 'dod ba yin no //🔽dris pa / mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro la lci ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par smra bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni tha mar zhabs su cung zad ces nyung shas cig ro dang bcas pa gsal ba dag tu'ang 'dod ba yin no // dris pa / mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro la lci ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par smra bar mi rigs te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro rnams ni yon tan nyid yin la /
translated: Because the taste of sweetness, etc. is a quality,

original: lci ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du yon tan yin te /
analyzed: lci ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du yon tan yin te /
translated: and heaviness, etc. are also qualities in the same way.

analyzed: des @124b na lci ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyi gnas mngar ba la sogs pa'i yon tan bshad par ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not correct to explain that the qualities of heaviness, etc. are the basis of the qualities of sweetness, etc.

original: gang gi phyir bye brag bdag gis yon tan la ni yon tan med ba zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bye brag bdag gis yon tan la ni yon tan med ba zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /

original: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: To respond to that, it is said:🔽The qualities of medicine, heaviness, etc.

original: sman gyi yon tan lci sogs dang // ro ni sa la sogs brten pas //
analyzed: sman gyi yon tan lci sogs dang // ro ni sa la sogs brten pas //

original: mtshungs par spyod bar nyer gdags pas //
analyzed: mtshungs par spyod bar nyer gdags pas //

original: ro las ming du btags ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ro las ming du btags ba yin // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: ro'i gnas la sogs pa la yang dag par na sman gyi yon tan lci ba la sogs pa yang gang yin par ni 'bras bu las dpag bar bya'o //

original: des na sman gyi yon tan lci ba yin la /
analyzed: des na sman gyi yon tan lci ba yin la /

original: lci ba de bstan pa'i ro yang yon tan lci ba yin par mtshungs shing thun mong du spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: lci ba de bstan pa'i ro yang yon tan lci ba yin par mtshungs shing thun mong du spyod pa yin te /

analyzed: lhan cig spyod bas na mtshungs par spyod pa zhes bya'o //

original: nye bar gdags pa ni cha 'dra bar spyod pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar gdags pa ni cha 'dra bar spyod pa ste /

original: ro la sogs pa la yon tan yod bar btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ro la sogs pa la yon tan yod bar btags pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the quality of heaviness, etc., is imputed to exist as a quality of taste, etc., by the designation of the similar enjoyer, the similar part.

original: yang dag par rol sogs pa'i yon tan yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rol sogs pa'i yon tan yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not have the qualities of being truly sweet, etc.

original: de bas na ro gtso bor gyur pa las ming du sgros btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ro gtso bor gyur pa las ming du sgros btags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the name is metaphorically applied to the primary element that is earth.

original: de la sa'i sman lci dang sbom //
analyzed: de la sa'i sman lci dang sbom //
translated: Among them, the earth element is heavy and solid,

original: sra zhing dri yi shas rab che //
analyzed: sra zhing dri yi shas rab che //

original: lci zhing brtan dang 'dus pa dang // nye bar 'phel bar byed pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lci zhing brtan dang 'dus pa dang // nye bar 'phel bar byed pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is heavy, stable, and compact, and it causes growth.

original: de la zhes ba de rnams kyi nang nas sa'i rang bzhin can gyi sman ni lci ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang dri zhes bya ba'i yon tan gyi shas rab tu che ba yin te /
analyzed: de la zhes ba de rnams kyi nang nas sa'i rang bzhin can gyi sman ni lci ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang dri zhes bya ba'i yon tan gyi shas rab tu che ba yin te /
translated: Among them, the earth element is the medicine that has the qualities of heaviness, etc., and it has a predominance of the quality called smell.

original: sa'i rang bzhin can gyi sman de'i lus ni /
analyzed: sa'i rang bzhin can gyi sman de'i lus ni /

original: lus la sogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: de la lci ba ni 'ju dka' zhing lci bar gyur pa nyid do //

original: brtan ba ni lus brtas bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtan ba ni lus brtas bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: nye bar 'phel ba ni lus zungs rnams rgyas bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: chu yi gsher dang lci bsil snum // rtul zhing bska la ro shas che //

original: 'jam zhing bad kan 'dra ba la //
analyzed: 'jam zhing bad kan 'dra ba la //

original: tan gyi shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: tan gyi shas che ba yin no //

translated: When applied to the body, it makes the body smooth and oily, causes the channels to ooze and drip with a phlegm-like fluid, causes food to soften and rot, satisfies and satiates the mind, and causes the joints, legs, and arms to contract and relax.

original: me yi rtsub rno tsha zhing skam //
analyzed: me yi rtsub rno tsha zhing skam //
translated: Firey [taste] is rough, sharp, hot, and drying.

original: phra zhing gzugs kyi yon tan che //
analyzed: phra zhing gzugs kyi yon tan che //

original: tsha zhing 'bar la mdog skyed cing //
analyzed: tsha zhing 'bar la mdog skyed cing //

analyzed: gsal zhing smin pa'i bdag nyid can // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de ni gzugs kyi yon tan gyi shas che ba yin no //

original: de zos shing spyad na lus tsha bar byed pa dang / mdangs 'bar bar 'gyur ba dang / lus kyi mdog skyed pa dang / gsal zhing snang ba dang ldan pa dang / zas smin cing 'ju bar byed pa'i yon tan can yin no //

translated: When it is eaten and used, it has the qualities of making the body hot, of giving rise to radiance, of producing the complexion of the body, of being clear and bright, and of ripening and digesting food.

original: rlung gi rtsub cing khyab la yang //
analyzed: rlung gi rtsub cing khyab la yang //

original: reg pa'i yon tan shas che yin //
analyzed: reg pa'i yon tan shas che yin //

original: rtsub cing yang la dri ma sel //
analyzed: rtsub cing yang la dri ma sel //

original: rnam dpyod na bar byed pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam dpyod na bar byed pa yin // zhes bya ba la /

original: rlung gi rang bzhin gyi sman ni /
analyzed: rlung gi rang bzhin gyi sman ni /

analyzed: rtsub pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / reg pa'i yon tan gyi shas che ba yin la /

translated: If it is relied upon in the body, it performs the function of having the qualities of roughness, lightness, and removing impurities.🔽The subtle, clear, and light

original: sgra yi yon tan shas che ste //
analyzed: sgra yi yon tan shas che ste //
translated: medicines of space have the quality of sound in excess.

original: khong stong yang bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: khong stong yang bar byed pa yin //
translated: They make the body hollow and light.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: nam mkha'i bdag nyid can gyi sman ni phra ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / sgra'i yon tan shas che ba yin no //
translated: the medicines that have the nature of space have the qualities of subtlety and so forth, and the quality of sound is in excess.

original: de lus kyis bsten na khong stong ste /
analyzed: de lus kyis bsten na khong stong ste /
translated: If they are relied upon in the body, they make the body hollow,

original: nang stong par byed pa dang / yang bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nang stong par byed pa dang / yang bar byed pa yin no //
translated: that is, they make the inside of the body empty, and they make the body light.

original: dris pa / rlung dang nam mkha'i ni gzugs med pa yin pas de'i bdag nyid can gyi rdzas yod par ga la 'gyur zhes pa la /
analyzed: dris pa / rlung dang nam mkha'i ni gzugs med pa yin pas de'i bdag nyid can gyi rdzas yod par ga la 'gyur zhes pa la /
translated: Question: Since wind and space are formless, how can there be a substance that has their nature?

original: nyes pa 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This fault does not exist because

original: sman gang la rtsub pa dang / khong stong gi las byed pa mang du snang la /
analyzed: sman gang la rtsub pa dang / khong stong gi las byed pa mang du snang la /
translated: the medicines that have the qualities of roughness and the function of making the body hollow are seen to be many.

analyzed: der ni rlung dang nam mkha'i bdag nyid can du nye bar gdags pas ming du btags pa yin te /
translated: There, it is designated by name, since it is designated as the nature of wind and space.

original: dper na dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba la sogs pa'i las byed pa mthong nas /
analyzed: dper na dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba la sogs pa'i las byed pa mthong nas /
translated: For example, when one sees the activity of faith, morality, learning, generosity, etc.,

original: skyes @125b bu dam pa dag la 'di ni lha yin no zhes nye bar 'dogs par byed pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: skyes @125b bu dam pa dag la 'di ni lha yin no zhes nye bar 'dogs par byed pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: one designates the holy person as “this is a god.”

original: de ltar 'gro na don dang ni //
analyzed: de ltar 'gro na don dang ni //
translated: Thus, there is nothing that is not medicine🔽in this world,

analyzed: sbyor ba sna tshogs dbang gis ni // sman min ci yang yod ma yin //
translated: due to the variety of applications🔽and the variety of illnesses.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, there is nothing that is not medicine in this world,

original: de ltar 'byung ba chen po las byung ba 'dis na /
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba chen po las byung ba 'dis na /
translated: since this world arises from the great elements.🔽Due to the variety of applications,

analyzed: sman lci ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas / 'gro ba ste 'khor ba'i gnas 'di /
translated: and the variety of illnesses.

analyzed: sman ma yin par gyur pa'i rdzas ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is nothing that is not medicine, since everything is medicine for some illness.

analyzed: gzhan du na thams cad nad sel bar byed pa'i dgos pa byed pas sman nyid yin no //
translated: Otherwise, everything would be medicine, since it would have the purpose of curing all illnesses.

analyzed: de yang ji ltar gyen du nyes pa sel bar byed nus pa'i dgos pa de'i don byed par nus pa dag gis stod du nyes pa sel te /
translated: Further, the upper part of the body is cleared of faults by those that are able to perform the function of removing faults upward.

original: me dang rlung gi shas che ba'i sman gang yin pa dag phal cher de byed par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: me dang rlung gi shas che ba'i sman gang yin pa dag phal cher de byed par nus pa yin te /

analyzed: rlung ni 'phar bar byed pa dang / me ni ring du 'bar bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de bas na ro stod kyi nad bsal ba'i don gyi dbang gis me dang rlung shas che ba'i sman gang yin pa de rnams de'i sman yin no //
translated: Therefore, those medicines with a predominance of fire and wind are medicines for the upper body because of their function of removing the faults of the upper body.

original: 'og gi nyes pa sel bar nus pa'i sman ni don de sgrub par byed nus pa dang / chu shas che ba'i sman gang yin pa dag phal cher ni de'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'og gi nyes pa sel bar nus pa'i sman ni don de sgrub par byed nus pa dang / chu shas che ba'i sman gang yin pa dag phal cher ni de'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Medicines that are able to remove the faults of the lower body are those that are able to accomplish that function and those that are mostly able to do that are medicines with a predominance of water.

original: sa ni lci ba nyid dang / dri dang ro ni chu'i rang bzhin yin te ;
analyzed: sa ni lci ba nyid dang / dri dang ro ni chu'i rang bzhin yin te ;
translated: This is because earth is heavy, smell and taste are the natures of water,🔽and

analyzed: de ltar na 'og gi nad sel ba'i rgyu'i dbang gis sa dang chu'i shas che ba'i rdzas gang yin pa de /
translated: Thus, the substance that is the cause of curing a disease below is one that is dominated by the elements of earth and water,

original: de'i sman gyi me dang rlung gi ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i sman gyi me dang rlung gi ma yin la /
translated: not by the elements of fire and wind.

analyzed: stod kyi nyes pa sel ba ni sa dang chu'i shas che ba dag ma yin no //
translated: The substance that cures an illness above is not dominated by the elements of earth and water.

original: de ltar na rgyu'i don gyi dbang gis rdzas la 'ga' zhig sman du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu'i don gyi dbang gis rdzas la 'ga' zhig sman du 'gyur ba yin gyi /

original: thams cad tham cad du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad tham cad du ni ma yin no //

original: de bzhin du sbyar ba'i dbang gis kyang rdzas la la dag la lar sman du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar ba'i dbang gis kyang rdzas la la dag la lar sman du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: In terms of the meaning of application, some substances are medicine for some illnesses.

original: sbyor ba gcig gis nad thams cad la sman du 'gyur ba ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis nad thams cad la sman du 'gyur ba ma yin mod kyi /
translated: But one application is not medicine for all illnesses.

original: 'on kyang sbyor ba'i dbang kha cig gis nad kha cig la sman du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sbyor ba'i dbang kha cig gis nad kha cig la sman du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: However, in terms of the meaning of application, some substances are medicine for some illnesses.

original: 'di ltar po son cha la sogs pa'i sman sbyor ba'i khyad par gzhan dag gis snga ma las lhag par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar po son cha la sogs pa'i sman sbyor ba'i khyad par gzhan dag gis snga ma las lhag par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the application of herbs such as poṣaṇa is medicine for some illnesses.

analyzed: ro la sogs pa ni ma yin no // gzhan dag tsha dang bsil nyid gnyis //

analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'o //

analyzed: 'dir de'i gtan tshigs smras pa ni /

analyzed: nam yang 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir 'og ma 'di smos ba yin te /

analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i tshul gyis sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can du gnas ba dag @128a * //

analyzed: de ltar na sman la la ni nyi ma'i rang bzhin can yin la /

original: de la tsha ba mgo 'khor skom //
analyzed: de la tsha ba mgo 'khor skom //

analyzed: rmya rngul tsha zhing myur 'ju byed //

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /

analyzed: myur 'ju byed ces bya ba ni zas myur ba nyid du 'ju bar byed do // rlung dang bad kan gnyis zhi bar byed pa ni /

analyzed: rlung nad dang bad kan gyi nad sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Pacifying wind and phlegm means it eliminates wind and phlegm disorders.

original: bsil ba dag ni tshim byed cing //
analyzed: bsil ba dag ni tshim byed cing //

analyzed: 'tsho dang rengs par byed pa dang // khrag dang mkhris pa rab dang byed //

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: sman bsil zhing stobs grang ba dang ldan pa ni tshim par byed pa la sogs pa dang / khrag dang mkhris pa rab tu dang bar byed do //

analyzed: de ni zhu ba zhes bshad do // zhes bya ba la / pho ba'i me dang sman phrad cing 'dus pa las gang ro gzhan du 'gyur ba ste /

analyzed: mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro gzhan dag tu byung bar gyur pa zas kyi las kyi mthar thug pa na /

original: zhes drang srong dag gis bshad do //
analyzed: zhes drang srong dag gis bshad do //

original: ji ltar mngar ba'i ro zos pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngar ba'i ro zos pa na /

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa ni / mngar dang lan tshva zhu rjes mngar //

analyzed: skyur pa'i zhu rjes skyur ba yin //

analyzed: kha dang tsha dang @128b bska ba rnams //

original: zhu rjes phal cher kha ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhu rjes phal cher kha ba yin // zhes bya ba la /

original: mngar ba ni ro zhim pa'o //
analyzed: mngar ba ni ro zhim pa'o //

original: lan tshva ni tshva rnams ta /
analyzed: lan tshva ni tshva rnams ta /

analyzed: de gnyis ni zhu ba'i rjes mngar ba'o //

original: ro skyur ba zos pa'i rjes kyang skyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: ro skyur ba zos pa'i rjes kyang skyur ba nyid yin no //

analyzed: ro kha ba dang tsha ba dang bska ba rnams ni phal cher kha bar 'ju ba yin no //

original: de la phal cher zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: de la phal cher zhes smos pa ni /

analyzed: kha cig tu 'dir smos pa dang mi mthun pa yod de / 'brul gnas pa'i ro mngar ba ni zhu ba'i rjes skyur bar 'gyur la /

original: des ni 'bru ni ro mngar yang zhu rjes skyur ba yin bas /
analyzed: des ni 'bru ni ro mngar yang zhu rjes skyur ba yin bas /
translated: Since barley is sweet but becomes sour after digestion,

original: mkhris pa skyed cing lci ba yin no //
analyzed: mkhris pa skyed cing lci ba yin no //

original: de bzhin du aa ru ra dang / bca' sga dang / sge'u gsher dang / pi pi ling la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du aa ru ra dang / bca' sga dang / sge'u gsher dang / pi pi ling la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to myrobalan, ginger, sugarcane juice, long pepper, and so on.

original: de yang bsdus ba las /
analyzed: de yang bsdus ba las /
translated: Also, the Compendium says:

original: 'bru ni mngar dang skyur ba nyid //
analyzed: 'bru ni mngar dang skyur ba nyid //

original: de bzhin se'u skyur yang mngar //
analyzed: de bzhin se'u skyur yang mngar //
translated: Similarly, pomegranate is sour and sweet.

original: til mar kha bar gyur pa dang // pi pi ling yang bska bar 'gyur //
analyzed: til mar kha bar gyur pa dang // pi pi ling yang bska bar 'gyur //
translated: Mustard oil becomes bitter, and long pepper becomes astringent.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar na 'bru ni mngar du zin kyang zhu ba'i rjes skyur bar 'gyur ba dang / se'u skyur yang mngar bar 'ju ba dang / til mar skyur du zin kyang kha bar 'ju ba dang / pi pi ling tsha yang zhu rjes bska bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, although grain is sweet, its post-digestive effect is sour; although the pomegranate is sour, it is sweet to digest; although sesame oil is sour, it is bitter to digest; and although black pepper is hot, its post-digestive effect is astringent.

original: des na 'di ltar mi mthun pa dag kyang yod pas phal cher zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ltar mi mthun pa dag kyang yod pas phal cher zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there are such incompatible cases, the root text states that the post-digestive effect is “mostly” the same as the taste.

original: ro dang zhu rjes 'bras bu mnyam //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ro dang zhu rjes 'bras bu mnyam // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The taste and post-digestive effect are the same in terms of their result.🔽The term “taste” refers to sweet, sour, and so on, which are the objects of the tongue.

original: ro zhes pa lce'i yul du gyur ba mngar ba dang / skyur ba la sogs pa dang / zhu ba'i rjes 'di ni 'bras bu yin pas mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin te /

translated: The post-digestive effect is the same as the taste in terms of its result.

original: 'di ni mngar ba'i ro myangs pa na lus tshim par byed pa la sogs pa gang byed pa de ni me tog lta bu yin te ;
analyzed: 'di ni mngar ba'i ro myangs pa na lus tshim par byed pa la sogs pa gang byed pa de ni me tog lta bu yin te ;
translated: The taste of something sweet, for example, is experienced by the tongue and it satisfies the body.

original: ro mngar ba de zhu ba dang / de mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: ro mngar ba de zhu ba dang / de mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: The post-digestive effect of that sweet taste is the same as the taste.

original: gang gzhan ro zhim pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gzhan ro zhim pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa de ni /
translated: The function of the other tastes, sweet, etc.,

original: ro mngar ba de'i 'bras bu yin pas thams cad du mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: ro mngar ba de'i 'bras bu yin pas thams cad du mthun pa yin no //
translated: is the result of that sweet taste.

original: ro mngar ba'i las ni 'ju brtul ba dang / lus zungs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ro mngar ba'i las ni 'ju brtul ba dang / lus zungs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa yin no //
translated: The function of sweet taste is to digest and to increase the bodily constituents.

original: de la sman ni bzang dang ngan //
analyzed: de la sman ni bzang dang ngan //
translated: Medicines are good or bad.

original: la la ro yis las byed la //
analyzed: la la ro yis las byed la //
translated: Some act by taste.

original: gzhan dag 'ju bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'ju bar byed pa yin //
translated: Others act by digestion.

original: yon tan gzhan dang nus pa dang // mthu yis la la byed pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan gzhan dang nus pa dang // mthu yis la la byed pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Some act by other qualities, potency, or power.
