analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba ste / sman dang / ro dang / nus pa dang / mthu stobs @129a * //
translated: Therein means that it is ascertained.

original: kyi nang nas /
analyzed: kyi nang nas /
translated: Among medicines, tastes, potencies, and powers,🔽medicines are good or bad.🔽Some act by taste.

original: sman bzang dang ngan zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i las sman la ni ro yis byed pa dang / bska ba dang bcas pas bad kan zhi bar byed cing /
analyzed: sman bzang dang ngan zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i las sman la ni ro yis byed pa dang / bska ba dang bcas pas bad kan zhi bar byed cing /
translated: For example, astringent taste pacifies phlegm,

original: nus ba bsil bar byed bas rlung skyed par byed do //
analyzed: nus ba bsil bar byed bas rlung skyed par byed do //
translated: and cool potency increases wind.

original: rlan can gyi sha'i chu ni nus pa dro ba yin pas mkhris pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rlan can gyi sha'i chu ni nus pa dro ba yin pas mkhris pa skyed par byed do //
translated: The water of moist meat has the potential to be hot, so it produces bile.

original: de bzhin du til mar ni zhu rjes kha ba nyid kyis bshang gci skyed la /🔽rang skyur yang rtsub cing dro ba yin pa dang bil ba'i rkang ni rtsub pas mkhris pa skyed pa dang / skyu ru ra ni nus pa bsil ba dang / zhu rjes mngar bas bad kan skyed pa dang / aang zhing rtsub kyang rlung mi skyed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du til mar ni zhu rjes kha ba nyid kyis bshang gci skyed la / rang skyur yang rtsub cing dro ba yin pa dang bil ba'i rkang ni rtsub pas mkhris pa skyed pa dang / skyu ru ra ni nus pa bsil ba dang / zhu rjes mngar bas bad kan skyed pa dang / aang zhing rtsub kyang rlung mi skyed pa dang /
translated: Likewise, since sesame oil is sweet after digestion, it produces feces and urine.🔽Since vinegar is rough and hot, and since the root of bilva is rough, they produce bile. Since tamarind has a cool potential and is sweet after digestion, it produces phlegm.🔽Since ginger is rough, it does not produce wind.

original: lan tshva lce myang tsha ni zhu rjes mngar pas mkhris pa sel zhing yang bad kan la phan pa dang / pu shel tse dang / bca' ska ni snum ba dang / dro ba dang / zhu rjes mngar bas rlung sel ba dang / pi pi ling yang de dang 'dra bas /
analyzed: lan tshva lce myang tsha ni zhu rjes mngar pas mkhris pa sel zhing yang bad kan la phan pa dang / pu shel tse dang / bca' ska ni snum ba dang / dro ba dang / zhu rjes mngar bas rlung sel ba dang / pi pi ling yang de dang 'dra bas /
translated: Since salt is sweet after digestion, it eliminates bile and also helps phlegm. Since pippali is oily, hot and sweet after digestion, it eliminates wind.

original: rlung sel ba dang / sgog skya dang kun dong dag ni snum pa dang / tsha ba dang / lci bas rlung sel bar byed la /
analyzed: rlung sel ba dang / sgog skya dang kun dong dag ni snum pa dang / tsha ba dang / lci bas rlung sel bar byed la /
translated: Garlic and onion are oily, hot and heavy, and therefore remove wind.

original: de dag ni snum pa dang / lci bas bad kan skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni snum pa dang / lci bas bad kan skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: But they are oily and heavy, and therefore generate phlegm.

original: la phug sgong po yang zhu rjes mngar bas bad kan skyed do //
analyzed: la phug sgong po yang zhu rjes mngar bas bad kan skyed do //
translated: The fruit of the eggplant is sweet after digestion, and therefore generates phlegm.

original: bri ha ti dang / kanda ka ri dang / byi sha la ni nus pa tsha bas mkhris pa skyed par byed pa dang / sha ni nus pa dro bas rlung sel zhing mkhris pa skyed pa dang / ku langtha ni ro bska yang zhu rjes bsil bas rlung sel zhing mkhris pa skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: bri ha ti dang / kanda ka ri dang / byi sha la ni nus pa tsha bas mkhris pa skyed par byed pa dang / sha ni nus pa dro bas rlung sel zhing mkhris pa skyed pa dang / ku langtha ni ro bska yang zhu rjes bsil bas rlung sel zhing mkhris pa skyed pa yin no //
translated: The brinjal, the kantakari, and the bhisha are hot in potency and therefore generate bile. Meat is warm in potency, and therefore removes wind and generates bile. The cucumber is astringent in taste, but cool after digestion, and therefore removes wind and generates bile.

original: de ltar na de dag ni phyogs gcig tsam gyi dper bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni phyogs gcig tsam gyi dper bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these are just examples of one aspect.

original: sman gyi ro sogs gang dang gang //
analyzed: sman gyi ro sogs gang dang gang //
translated: Whatever taste, etc. of medicine

original: stobs ldan nyid kyis gnas byed de //
analyzed: stobs ldan nyid kyis gnas byed de //
translated: is dominant, it will act.

original: shin tu zil gnon de dang de //
analyzed: shin tu zil gnon de dang de //
translated: Whatever is very dominant

original: sgrub byed rgyu ni nyid du gnas //
analyzed: sgrub byed rgyu ni nyid du gnas //
translated: is the cause of the effect.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

original: sman gyi ris su gtogs ba'i ro dang / nus pa dang / 'ju ba dang mthu gang dang gang yin pa de dag gi nang nas /
analyzed: sman gyi ris su gtogs ba'i ro dang / nus pa dang / 'ju ba dang mthu gang dang gang yin pa de dag gi nang nas /
translated: Among the tastes, potencies, digestions, and efficacies of the various medicinal ingredients,

original: stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyis sman la gnas par byed pa de ni ;
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyis sman la gnas par byed pa de ni ;
translated: the one that is most powerful becomes the basis of the medicine.

original: sman gyi rigs de shin tu zil gyis mnan cing stobs chung ba gzhan dag pham par byas nas /
analyzed: sman gyi rigs de shin tu zil gyis mnan cing stobs chung ba gzhan dag pham par byas nas /
translated: It overwhelms the other ingredients, which are weaker, and defeats them.

original: gnas bde dang de ni bya ba gang sgrub par byed pa de dag ni /🔽rgyu nyid du gnas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gnas bde dang de ni bya ba gang sgrub par byed pa de dag ni / rgyu nyid du gnas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The medicine is established as the cause of whatever it is supposed to accomplish.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no //🔽de yang ros ni 'di byas so //🔽nus @129b pas ni 'di byas so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no // de yang ros ni 'di byas so // nus @129b pas ni 'di byas so //
translated: It is established as the agent that accomplishes whatever it is supposed to accomplish.🔽It is as if the medicine were to say, “I did this with my taste!🔽I did this with my potency!

original: stobs kyis ni 'di byas so //🔽zhes bya ba lta bu'o //🔽don 'di nyid kyis dper brjod pa /
analyzed: stobs kyis ni 'di byas so // zhes bya ba lta bu'o // don 'di nyid kyis dper brjod pa /
translated: I did this with my efficacy!”🔽This is the meaning of the analogy.

original: bsdus pa las spros te bshad pa 'dir bstan pa yin la //
analyzed: bsdus pa las spros te bshad pa 'dir bstan pa yin la //
translated: This is what is being taught in this section, which is an extensive explanation of the condensed statement.

original: gang 'di ltar ro la sogs pa'i rigs su gtogs pas ro gzhan dag la stobs dang ldan par gnas shig de dang de nyid du zil gyis mnan nas sgrub pa'i rgyu nyid du byed kyi /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar ro la sogs pa'i rigs su gtogs pas ro gzhan dag la stobs dang ldan par gnas shig de dang de nyid du zil gyis mnan nas sgrub pa'i rgyu nyid du byed kyi /
translated: Since it belongs to the class of tastes, etc., it is powerful with respect to other tastes, etc. It is the cause for subduing and eliminating them.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi stobs la gnas pa dang / stobs dang ldan pa dang / stobs chung ba dang / gnyi ga'i tshul gyis rang rang gi las byed pa yin pas na /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi stobs la gnas pa dang / stobs dang ldan pa dang / stobs chung ba dang / gnyi ga'i tshul gyis rang rang gi las byed pa yin pas na /
translated: It performs its own function by means of its own power and the power of others, whether it is powerful or weak, and by means of both.

original: de'i phyir 'di bstan par bya ba smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di bstan par bya ba smras pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the following verse is stated to illustrate this.

original: yon tan mi 'phrod sbyar ba ni //
analyzed: yon tan mi 'phrod sbyar ba ni //
translated: The combination of incompatible qualities

original: mang pos nyung du zil gyis gnon //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mang pos nyung du zil gyis gnon // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: is overpowered by the greater number.

original: gang gi phyir yon tan mi 'phrod pa dag sbyar zhing bsres pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yon tan mi 'phrod pa dag sbyar zhing bsres pa ni /
translated: The combination of incompatible qualities

original: mang po stobs dang ldan pas /
analyzed: mang po stobs dang ldan pas /
translated: is overpowered by the greater number.🔽The combination of incompatible qualities is a mixture of qualities that are not compatible with each other.🔽The greater number of powerful qualities

original: stobs chung du zil gyis gnon cing rgyal bar byed do //
analyzed: stobs chung du zil gyis gnon cing rgyal bar byed do //
translated: overpowers and defeats the weaker qualities.

original: yon tan mi 'phrod ces bya ba 'dir ni /
analyzed: yon tan mi 'phrod ces bya ba 'dir ni /
translated: In this verse, “incompatible qualities”

original: rdzas mi 'phrod pa'i sbyor ba la bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas mi 'phrod pa'i sbyor ba la bya'o //
translated: refers to the combination of incompatible substances.

original: yon tan mi 'phrod pa nyid du ni smra bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan mi 'phrod pa nyid du ni smra bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not right to say that the qualities are not suitable.

original: de yang drang srong tsa ra kas bshad pa /
analyzed: de yang drang srong tsa ra kas bshad pa /
translated: This is explained by the sage Caraka:

original: sbyor ba ni rdzas gnyis sam rdzas mang po sbyar ba yin la /🔽de yang mi 'phrod pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rdzas gnyis sam rdzas mang po sbyar ba yin la / de yang mi 'phrod pa ni gnyis te /
translated: The combination is the combination of two substances or many substances.

original: rang bzhin mi 'phrod pa dang / 'bras bu mi 'phrod pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi 'phrod pa dang / 'bras bu mi 'phrod pa'o //
translated: And that is twofold: unsuitable by nature and unsuitable by effect.

original: rang bzhin mi 'phrod pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi 'phrod pa ni /
translated: Unsuitable by nature is

original: dper na sman yang pa dang / lci ba sbyar ba dang / chab dang bsil ba sbyar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na sman yang pa dang / lci ba sbyar ba dang / chab dang bsil ba sbyar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: for example, the combination of a light and heavy medicine, or a cold and hot medicine, and so on.

original: 'bras bu mi 'phrod pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi 'phrod pa ni /
translated: Unsuitable by effect is

original: dper na rlung gi nad bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dper na rlung gi nad bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: for example, for the purpose of eliminating a wind disorder,

original: sman rtsub pa dang / ro lhan cig sbyar ba dang / de bzhin du bsil ba dang / dro ba dang lhan cig sbyar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sman rtsub pa dang / ro lhan cig sbyar ba dang / de bzhin du bsil ba dang / dro ba dang lhan cig sbyar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the combination of a rough and sweet medicine, or a cold and hot medicine, and so on.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin gyis yon tan mi 'phrod pa'i sman gyi sbyor ba dang / de bzhin du 'bras bu mi 'phrod pa'i sman gyi sbyor ba phan tshun rigs mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba de ni /
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin gyis yon tan mi 'phrod pa'i sman gyi sbyor ba dang / de bzhin du 'bras bu mi 'phrod pa'i sman gyi sbyor ba phan tshun rigs mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba de ni /
translated: Thus, a medicinal preparation that is naturally incompatible with a quality, and likewise a medicinal preparation that is incompatible with a result, is a preparation of mutually incompatible types.

original: gang zas kyi rigs nyung du rdzas kyi rigs mang pos zil gyis mnan nas ;
analyzed: gang zas kyi rigs nyung du rdzas kyi rigs mang pos zil gyis mnan nas ;
translated: That is suppressed by a small type of food with many types of substances,

original: de nyid du rgyu nyid du sgrub par byed par gnas par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nyid du rgyu nyid du sgrub par byed par gnas par mthong ngo //
translated: and is seen to remain as a cause for that very thing.

original: de yang dper na sbrang rtsi ni mngar du zin kyang bad kan zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang dper na sbrang rtsi ni mngar du zin kyang bad kan zhi bar byed do //
translated: For example, although honey is sweet, it pacifies phlegm.

original: ro mngar ba ni bad kan skyed par byed pa yin yang /
analyzed: ro mngar ba ni bad kan skyed par byed pa yin yang /
translated: Although a sweet taste produces phlegm,

original: sbrang rtsi bad kan zhi bar byed pa ni mi mthun pa mi 'phrod pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽de @130a * //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi bad kan zhi bar byed pa ni mi mthun pa mi 'phrod pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // de @130a * //
translated: honey pacifies phlegm because it has the quality of being incompatible and unpalatable.

original: ltar na rigs mthun pa'i mtshan nyid sbyor ba las kyang gang zhig gang gis zil gyis mnan nas /
analyzed: ltar na rigs mthun pa'i mtshan nyid sbyor ba las kyang gang zhig gang gis zil gyis mnan nas /
translated: Thus, even in a preparation with a similar type of characteristic, whatever is suppressed by whatever

original: rang rgyud du grub pa yin par som nyir gyur pa de dgag par bya ba'i phyir 'dir smras pa ni /
analyzed: rang rgyud du grub pa yin par som nyir gyur pa de dgag par bya ba'i phyir 'dir smras pa ni /
translated: In order to refute the doubt that they are established as autonomous, it is said here:

original: ro dang 'ju ba'i mthu dag ni //
analyzed: ro dang 'ju ba'i mthu dag ni //
translated: The power of taste and digestion

original: de yi stobs kyis zil gyis gnon //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yi stobs kyis zil gyis gnon // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: is overwhelmed by the power of that.

original: ro dang nus pa dang 'ju ba dang / stobs rnams ni ci ltar lhan cig sbyar zhing nus pa mnyam pa yin du zin kyang rang bzhin gyis 'ju bas ni ro zil gyis mnan te de'i nus pa med par byas nas /
analyzed: ro dang nus pa dang 'ju ba dang / stobs rnams ni ci ltar lhan cig sbyar zhing nus pa mnyam pa yin du zin kyang rang bzhin gyis 'ju bas ni ro zil gyis mnan te de'i nus pa med par byas nas /
translated: Even though taste, potency, digestion, and power are combined in the same way and have equal potency, digestion by nature overwhelms taste and eliminates its potency.

original: rang gi bya ba bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: rang gi bya ba bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Through the door of demonstrating its own function,

original: de'i nus pa zil gyis mnan nas /
analyzed: de'i nus pa zil gyis mnan nas /
translated: it overwhelms the potency of taste.

original: rang gi nus pa gsal bar ston to //
analyzed: rang gi nus pa gsal bar ston to //
translated: It clearly demonstrates its own potency.

original: de bzhin du ro dang 'ju ba de gnyis kyang mthus zil gyis gnon la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ro dang 'ju ba de gnyis kyang mthus zil gyis gnon la /
translated: In the same way, taste and digestion are overwhelmed by power.

original: mthu de rnams kyi stobs kyis zil gyis gnon pa yin no //
analyzed: mthu de rnams kyi stobs kyis zil gyis gnon pa yin no //
translated: The power of those powers is overwhelmed.

original: ro sogs de ltar stobs ni mnyam //
analyzed: ro sogs de ltar stobs ni mnyam //
translated: Taste and so forth are equal in power.

original: ma bcos pa ni stobs dang ldan //
analyzed: ma bcos pa ni stobs dang ldan //
translated: The unfabricated is powerful.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is said:

original: ro dang 'ju ba dang mthu dang stobs rnams ni /
analyzed: ro dang 'ju ba dang mthu dang stobs rnams ni /
translated: are equal in strength.

original: de ltar zhes pa rnam pa 'dis stobs mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa rnam pa 'dis stobs mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: The strength of those who observe the ethics of eating in moderation is equal and the same in this way.

original: de'i stobs ni ro la sogs pa la dmigs nas ma bcos pa gang yin pa de ni stobs dang ldan par bshad de /🔽rdzas gang gi ro mngar ba de ji skad bshad pa bzhin du 'ju ba mngar ba dang ldan pa dang ; de bzhin du nus pa bsil ba dang ldan pa ni stobs che ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i stobs ni ro la sogs pa la dmigs nas ma bcos pa gang yin pa de ni stobs dang ldan par bshad de / rdzas gang gi ro mngar ba de ji skad bshad pa bzhin du 'ju ba mngar ba dang ldan pa dang ; de bzhin du nus pa bsil ba dang ldan pa ni stobs che ba yin la /
translated: The strength of those who observe the ethics of eating in moderation is explained as powerful since it is unfabricated by focusing on taste and so on.🔽Any substance that has a sweet taste has a sweet digestion and similarly, if it has a cooling potency, it has great strength.

original: de bzhin du ro skyur ba ji skad bshad pa'i zhu rjes skyur ba dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du ro skyur ba ji skad bshad pa'i zhu rjes skyur ba dang ldan zhing /
translated: Any substance that has a sour taste has a sour digestion and similarly, if it has a hot potency, it has great strength.

original: de bzhin du tsha ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du ro tsha ba dang ji skad bshad pa'i 'ju ba'i tsha ba dang ldan zhing dro ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du 'o ma dang chang dang / na le sham la sogs pa las 'o ma ni ro mngar la 'ju ba dang nus pa bsil ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du tsha ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du ro tsha ba dang ji skad bshad pa'i 'ju ba'i tsha ba dang ldan zhing dro ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du 'o ma dang chang dang / na le sham la sogs pa las 'o ma ni ro mngar la 'ju ba dang nus pa bsil ba dang /
translated: Similarly, it is endowed with the potency of heat, and similarly, it is endowed with the potency of heat of taste and the potency of heat of digestion as explained above.🔽Similarly, milk and beer and black pepper and so on are known as endowed with the potency of sweet taste, the potency of digestion and the potency of cool potency,

original: chang ni skyur la 'ju ba dang nus pa dro pa dang / na le sham ni ro tsha la 'ju ba dang nus pa dro ba skyed pa dang / sman de dag ni ro dang 'ju ba dang nus pa dang stobs mnyam pa sam bcos pa'i stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chang ni skyur la 'ju ba dang nus pa dro pa dang / na le sham ni ro tsha la 'ju ba dang nus pa dro ba skyed pa dang / sman de dag ni ro dang 'ju ba dang nus pa dang stobs mnyam pa sam bcos pa'i stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: beer is sour in taste, digests heat and has the potency of heat, black pepper is hot in taste, digests heat and generates the potency of heat, and those medicines are known as endowed with equal taste, digestion, potency and strength or as endowed with the potency of combination.

original: kho bo cag gis ro dang 'ju ba dang nus pa'i rang bzhin ci lta bu yin pa des ni las la rjes su dpag pas shes pas ni /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ro dang 'ju ba dang nus pa'i rang bzhin ci lta bu yin pa des ni las la rjes su dpag pas shes pas ni /
translated: Since we know the nature of taste, digestion and potency through inference from action,

original: mthu zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin shes par dka' bas de mi shes pas the tshom du gyur na mthu ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: mthu zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin shes par dka' bas de mi shes pas the tshom du gyur na mthu ni gang zhig yin /
translated: Power is difficult to understand because its nature is difficult to know. If it is not understood, then what is power?

original: gang las ni rjes su @130b dpag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang las ni rjes su @130b dpag par bya zhe na /
translated: From what is it inferred?

original: 'dir smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ni /
translated: Here it is said:

original: ro sogs mnyam ba'i las gang ni //🔽khyad 'phags de ni mthu las skyes //
analyzed: ro sogs mnyam ba'i las gang ni // khyad 'phags de ni mthu las skyes //
translated: Any action that is the same as taste and so on

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: is born from power, which is superior to that.

original: ro la sogs pa mnyam zhing mtshungs pa nyid kyis las gang khyad par du 'phags pa sman gang la snang ba de ni mthu las skyes ba yin bar shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: ro la sogs pa mnyam zhing mtshungs pa nyid kyis las gang khyad par du 'phags pa sman gang la snang ba de ni mthu las skyes ba yin bar shes par bya'o ;
translated: Any action that is superior due to being the same as and equal to taste and so on is to be understood as born from power.

original: / rjes su dpag pa des na mthu zhes bya ba shes par bya ste /
analyzed: / rjes su dpag pa des na mthu zhes bya ba shes par bya ste /
translated: That power is to be understood by inference.

original: 'di ni rdzas kyi mthu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rdzas kyi mthu yin no //
translated: This is the power of substances.

original: de yang sman gnyis ro mtshungs pa dang nus pa mnyam du zin kyang de la sman gcig las gzhan byed la cig shos kyang las gzhan byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de yang sman gnyis ro mtshungs pa dang nus pa mnyam du zin kyang de la sman gcig las gzhan byed la cig shos kyang las gzhan byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, although two medicines have the same taste and potency, one performs a different function than the other.

original: des ni stobs kyis stobs yod pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des ni stobs kyis stobs yod pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that potency is the existence of potency.

original: de ltar na sman re re'i 'jug ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos rang gi rang bzhin dngos po rkyen tshogs pa las byung ba nges par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can de ni mthu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sman re re'i 'jug ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos rang gi rang bzhin dngos po rkyen tshogs pa las byung ba nges par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can de ni mthu zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the potency of each medicine is the nature of the medicine itself, which is characterized by the presence of a cause and the assembly of conditions.

original: dngos po gzhan gyi mthu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan gyi mthu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the potency of another thing.

original: dan ti dang ni tsi tra ka / ro sogs mtshungs kyang dan ti 'khru //
analyzed: dan ti dang ni tsi tra ka / ro sogs mtshungs kyang dan ti 'khru //
translated: Dandi and citraka have similar tastes and so forth, but dandi is purgative.

original: shing mngar rgun 'brum 'dra yang 'khru //🔽'o ma mar 'dra mar drod skyed //
analyzed: shing mngar rgun 'brum 'dra yang 'khru // 'o ma mar 'dra mar drod skyed //
translated: Sweet wood and grapes are similar, but grapes are purgative.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Milk and ghee are similar, but ghee generates heat.

original: de ltar na sman dan ti dang / tsi tra ka ni ro dang nus pa'i zhu rjes mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na sman dan ti dang / tsi tra ka ni ro dang nus pa'i zhu rjes mtshungs te /
translated: Thus, the medicine dandi and citraka have similar tastes, potency, and post digestive taste.

original: tsi tra ka la ro dang nus pa dang 'ju ba'i rjes gang dag yod pa de dag dan ti la yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: tsi tra ka la ro dang nus pa dang 'ju ba'i rjes gang dag yod pa de dag dan ti la yod du zin kyang /
translated: Whatever tastes, potency, and post digestive taste exist in citraka also exist in dandi.

original: dan ti ni dan ti rang nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'khru bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dan ti ni dan ti rang nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'khru bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: However, dandi is purgative by its own characteristics.

original: tsi tra ka ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tsi tra ka ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the sweet taste is the same as the fruit,

original: de lta bu'i khyad par gyi chos la mthu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i khyad par gyi chos la mthu zhes bya'o //
translated: but rather that the fruit has the capacity to produce the sweet taste.

original: de bzhin du mngar ba dang / rgun 'brum ro mngar ba la sogs par mthun du zin kyang rgun 'brum 'khru bar byed kyi shing mngar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngar ba dang / rgun 'brum ro mngar ba la sogs par mthun du zin kyang rgun 'brum 'khru bar byed kyi shing mngar ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, although sugar cane and grapes are similar in being sweet, the sugar cane causes purgation while grapes do not.

original: de bzhin du 'o ma dang / mar la sogs pa mtshungs su zin kyang 'o ma ni 'o mar gyur pas drod mi skyed kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'o ma dang / mar la sogs pa mtshungs su zin kyang 'o ma ni 'o mar gyur pas drod mi skyed kyi /
translated: In the same way, although milk and butter are similar, milk does not produce heat,

original: mar gyis drod skyed do //
analyzed: mar gyis drod skyed do //
translated: but butter does.

original: de bzhin du thams cad kyang mthu las gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad kyang mthu las gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, all things are produced from capacity.

original: 'di ltar re zhig dngos po thams cad la yang spyi dang khyad par gyis khyab pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig dngos po thams cad la yang spyi dang khyad par gyis khyab pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, since all things are pervaded by universals and particulars,

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos byed pas smas pa ni /🔽de ltar sman la sogs pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos byed pas smas pa ni / de ltar sman la sogs pa yi //
translated: the author of the treatise states:🔽Thus, the universal activity of medicine,

original: spyi yi las te de yang ni //
analyzed: spyi yi las te de yang ni //
translated: and so on, is also

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: like that.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yongs su rdzogs ba'i tshig gam rnam ba'i don no //🔽de yang sman la sogs pa'i @131a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yongs su rdzogs ba'i tshig gam rnam ba'i don no // de yang sman la sogs pa'i @131a * //
translated: The word “thus” has the sense of completion or of mode.🔽Moreover, the universal activity of the taste, digestion, potency, and efficacy of medicine, etc.

original: ro dang 'ju ba dang nus pa dang mthu spyi'i las rdzogs pa yin gyi khyad par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ro dang 'ju ba dang nus pa dang mthu spyi'i las rdzogs pa yin gyi khyad par ni ma yin te /
translated: is completed, not the particularities.

original: de rtsom bar byed pa'i 'byung ba chen po spyi'i las byung ba na spyi'i rkyen spyi'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de rtsom bar byed pa'i 'byung ba chen po spyi'i las byung ba na spyi'i rkyen spyi'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: When the universal activity of the primary elements that are the cause of their production is produced, the universal condition is produced from the universal cause.

original: yang na rnam pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa'i don te /
translated: Or, it has the sense of mode.

original: rnam pa 'dis sman la sogs pa spyi'i las nyid bshad kyi khyad par gyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis sman la sogs pa spyi'i las nyid bshad kyi khyad par gyi ni ma yin te /
translated: By this mode, the universal activity of medicine, etc. is explained, not the particularities.

original: 'byung ba chen po dag gi sman la brten pa'i ro dang mthu la sogs pa ji ltar bskyed pa spyi'i rgyu bstan pa de bzhin du de'i las kyang spyi tsam du bstan to //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dag gi sman la brten pa'i ro dang mthu la sogs pa ji ltar bskyed pa spyi'i rgyu bstan pa de bzhin du de'i las kyang spyi tsam du bstan to //

analyzed: de yang sems can tha dad pa rnams kyis sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba byas pa'i las las byung ba'i 'byung ba chen po de rnams sna tshogs shing tha dad pa de lta bur yongs su 'gyur ba'i rkyen sna tshogs pa rnams kyis bskyed pa'i sman de

analyzed: sa rlung zhes bya ba 'byung bas dang rlung gi shas che ba las ni ro bska ba 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de lta na gnyis gnyis las 'byung ba yin no //

analyzed: de ltar na shas che ba'i dbang gis na ro mngar ba ni 'byung pa thams cad kyis bskyed du zin kyang /

analyzed: sa dang chu las byung ba yin zhes bshad pa yin no //

translated: The third has ten sweet tastes, six sour tastes,🔽and four salty tastes.

original: lan tshva gsum ste kha ba gcig / ces bya ba yin pas na nyi shu'o //🔽gcig nyid de /🔽sman ni ro drug ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: lan tshva gsum ste kha ba gcig / ces bya ba yin pas na nyi shu'o // gcig nyid de / sman ni ro drug ces bya ba ni /
translated: The three salts are one, and the six medicines are one.🔽Thus there are twenty.🔽The six tastes are one.

original: sman ni @139b ro drug gcig pu yin //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sman ni @139b ro drug gcig pu yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The six medicines are one.🔽Thus there are six.

original: de ltar drug cu rtsa gsum zhes bya ba ni ro rnams kyi dbye ba drug cu rtsa gsum yod ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar drug cu rtsa gsum zhes bya ba ni ro rnams kyi dbye ba drug cu rtsa gsum yod ba'o //
translated: Thus there are thirty-six.

original: de dag kyang gong du grangs lnga bcu rtsa bdun du chad pa'i bcos mar yongs su dbye ba'i sbyor ba dang bcas par bshad pa dang / ma bcos pa'i ro drug ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang gong du grangs lnga bcu rtsa bdun du chad pa'i bcos mar yongs su dbye ba'i sbyor ba dang bcas par bshad pa dang / ma bcos pa'i ro drug ste /
translated: The six tastes are divided into fifty-seven in the above, and the six unprocessed tastes are explained as being combined with the processed tastes.

original: ro drug cur ro rnams dbye bar bshad ba gang yin pa de ni dgos pa'i dbang du byas pa las /🔽mtshon cing lus la dgos pa'i yul du rigs pa nyid las /
analyzed: ro drug cur ro rnams dbye bar bshad ba gang yin pa de ni dgos pa'i dbang du byas pa las / mtshon cing lus la dgos pa'i yul du rigs pa nyid las /
translated: The thirty-six tastes that are explained as being divided are done so in terms of their purpose.

original: rags rim ji lta ba bzhin du phye zhing bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rags rim ji lta ba bzhin du phye zhing bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: They are divided and explained in terms of the coarse, in terms of the objects that are necessary for the body.

original: phra ba rnams kyi sbyor ba brtsis pa'i tshul 'di tsam du zad pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: phra ba rnams kyi sbyor ba brtsis pa'i tshul 'di tsam du zad pa yang ma yin la /
translated: This is not the only way to calculate the combinations of the subtle.

original: dbye ba yang drug cu rtsa gsum du zad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbye ba yang drug cu rtsa gsum du zad pa ma yin te /
translated: The divisions are not exhausted in just sixty-three.

original: gang gi phyir phra zhing rab tu phra bar brtag pa dang / de bzhin du rab dang mchog tu brtag pa'i dbang dang / de bzhin ro dang ro rjes kyi dgos pa'i dbang las ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phra zhing rab tu phra bar brtag pa dang / de bzhin du rab dang mchog tu brtag pa'i dbang dang / de bzhin ro dang ro rjes kyi dgos pa'i dbang las ni /
translated: Because, from the perspective of the subtle and very subtle, and likewise, from the perspective of the best and supreme, and likewise, from the perspective of the need for taste and the taste of the aftermath,

original: 'di rnams kyi dbye ba grangs med pa yin pas na /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi dbye ba grangs med pa yin pas na /
translated: their divisions are countless.

original: 'di dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'di dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach these, it is said:

original: de rnams ro dang ro rjes ro'i dbye ba //
analyzed: de rnams ro dang ro rjes ro'i dbye ba //
translated: Those are divided by taste, the taste of the aftermath,

original: rab dang rab mchog dag tu brags pa las //
analyzed: rab dang rab mchog dag tu brags pa las //
translated: and by the best and supreme.

original: rtsis las 'das par byung bar gyur ba ni //🔽nad dang sman gyi dbang las nye bar sbyar //
analyzed: rtsis las 'das par byung bar gyur ba ni // nad dang sman gyi dbang las nye bar sbyar //
translated: They arise beyond calculation

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and are applied from the perspective of illness and medicine.

original: drug cu rtsa gsum gyi grangs kyi dbye bas phye ba de rnams ni rtsis las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: drug cu rtsa gsum gyi grangs kyi dbye bas phye ba de rnams ni rtsis las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Those divided by the sixty-three divisions are beyond calculation.

original: shin tu mang ba'i phyir brtsi bar mi nus bar 'gyur zhing skyes par gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: shin tu mang ba'i phyir brtsi bar mi nus bar 'gyur zhing skyes par gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because they are very numerous, they cannot be calculated and they arise.

original: de ci lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ci lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ro dang rjes kyi dbye ba las te /
analyzed: ro dang rjes kyi dbye ba las te /
translated: and by the division of taste and post-taste.

original: de bas 'byung ba 'dus pa las //
analyzed: de bas 'byung ba 'dus pa las //
translated: Thus, from the combination of elements,

original: byung bas sman rnams ro gcig min //
analyzed: byung bas sman rnams ro gcig min //
translated: the medicines are not of one taste.

original: zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ro dang rjes de gnyis kyang 'di ltar mngar ba'i rjes ni skyur ba la sogs pa yin la /🔽skyur ba'i rjes ni mngar ba la sogs pa yin pa dang / de bzhin du skyur ba ni lan tshva'i la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ro dang rjes de gnyis kyang 'di ltar mngar ba'i rjes ni skyur ba la sogs pa yin la / skyur ba'i rjes ni mngar ba la sogs pa yin pa dang / de bzhin du skyur ba ni lan tshva'i la sogs pa'o //
translated: The two, taste and post-taste, are like this: the post-taste of sweet is sour, etc.,🔽and the post-taste of sour is sweet, etc.🔽Likewise, sour is salty, etc.,

original: lan tshva ni kha ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lan tshva ni kha ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and salty is bitter, etc.

original: de rnams zhes bya ba'i tshig gis thams cad la snyegs su zin kyang /
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba'i tshig gis thams cad la snyegs su zin kyang /
translated: Although the word “those” refers to all of them,

original: lnga bcu rtsa bdun bo nyid la ci rigs par ro dang ro rjes kyi dbye ba byas na grangs med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa bdun bo nyid la ci rigs par ro dang ro rjes kyi dbye ba byas na grangs med par 'gyur la /
translated: when the division of taste and post-taste is applied to the fifty-seven [medicines] in the appropriate way, they become innumerable.

original: ro drug po 'ba' zhig la rab dang rab mchog la sogs pa'i brtag @140a * //
analyzed: ro drug po 'ba' zhig la rab dang rab mchog la sogs pa'i brtag @140a * //
translated: The six tastes alone are analyzed as superior, best, etc.

original: pa las grangs med bar 'gyur ba lta su zhig 'gog / de gnyis kyis na rab dang / rab mchog dag tu brtag pa las zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: pa las grangs med bar 'gyur ba lta su zhig 'gog / de gnyis kyis na rab dang / rab mchog dag tu brtag pa las zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: The two, sweet and astringent, are considered to be supreme and excellent.🔽The supreme and excellent are distinguished by the combination and non-combination of tastes.

original: ro sbyar ba dang / ma sbyar ba'i dbye ba mchog dang / rab mchog dag tu brtag pa ni 'di ltar mngar ba dang / rab tu mngar ba dang / rab mchog tu mngar ba dang / cung zad mngar ba dang / cung zad rab tu mngar ba dang /
analyzed: ro sbyar ba dang / ma sbyar ba'i dbye ba mchog dang / rab mchog dag tu brtag pa ni 'di ltar mngar ba dang / rab tu mngar ba dang / rab mchog tu mngar ba dang / cung zad mngar ba dang / cung zad rab tu mngar ba dang /
translated: Thus, sweet, very sweet, supremely sweet, slightly sweet, very slightly sweet,

original: cung zad rab mchog tu mngar ba ste /
analyzed: cung zad rab mchog tu mngar ba ste /
translated: and supremely slightly sweet.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the others.

original: yang ro'i dbye ba de rnams nad kyi sman gyi dbang gis nye bar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang ro'i dbye ba de rnams nad kyi sman gyi dbang gis nye bar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, those varieties of taste should be applied according to the medicine for a disease.

original: de la nad ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nad ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the disease is wind and so on.

original: sman ni aa ru ra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sman ni aa ru ra la sogs pa'o //
translated: The medicine is myrobalan and so on.

original: nad dang sman gyi mngar ba ni de'i ched dam /🔽dbang du byas pa'am /
analyzed: nad dang sman gyi mngar ba ni de'i ched dam / dbang du byas pa'am /
translated: Sweetness of the disease and medicine is for that purpose,🔽or it is governed by that,

original: de la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: de la ltos pa ste /
translated: or it is dependent on that.

original: de'i dbang du byas pa las yongs su brtags te sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas pa las yongs su brtags te sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In this regard, one should apply the analysis by way of the examination of the humors.

original: bab bab tu 'chol bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bab bab tu 'chol bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the case that one should apply them in a haphazard manner.

original: nad dang sman zhes smos pa ni nye bar mtshon ba tsam yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nad dang sman zhes smos pa ni nye bar mtshon ba tsam yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The mention of “illness and medicine” should be understood as merely an illustration.

original: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i rnam par 'grel pa tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i rnam par 'grel pa tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
translated: The Moonbeams of the Meaning of the Words, a commentary on the essence of the eight branches,

original: slob dbon zla ba la dga' bas rnam par sbyar ba las /
analyzed: slob dbon zla ba la dga' bas rnam par sbyar ba las /
translated: was composed by the master Candrakīrti.

original: le'u bcu pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o ;
analyzed: le'u bcu pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o ;
translated: This is the commentary on the tenth chapter.

original: // / de nas nad la sogs pa'i tshul shes par bya ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / de nas nad la sogs pa'i tshul shes par bya ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Now, the chapter on the knowledge of illness and so on should be explained.

original: de'i rjes thogs la nad la sogs pa shes par bya ba brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes thogs la nad la sogs pa shes par bya ba brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Immediately after that, the knowledge of illness and so on should be begun.

original: gang gi phyir ro rnams kyis dbye ba drug cu rtsa gsum gyis phye ba de dag kyang nad kyi sman gyi dbang du sbyar bar bya ba yin par bshad la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ro rnams kyis dbye ba drug cu rtsa gsum gyis phye ba de dag kyang nad kyi sman gyi dbang du sbyar bar bya ba yin par bshad la /
translated: Because the sixty-three divisions by way of the humors are explained to be applied by way of the medicine for illness.

original: de lta bas na nad las rjes su dpags te sbyar bar bya'i /
analyzed: de lta bas na nad las rjes su dpags te sbyar bar bya'i /
translated: Therefore, one should infer from the disease and apply the treatment.

original: bab bab tu 'chol bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bab bab tu 'chol bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: One should not act haphazardly.

original: de bas na nad de rnams ni rang gi las kyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba nyid las rjes su dpags te shes par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de bas na nad de rnams ni rang gi las kyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba nyid las rjes su dpags te shes par bya dgos te /
translated: Thus, one should infer from the characteristics of one's own karma and understand the diseases.

original: de shes par bya ba'i phyir na le'u 'di brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de shes par bya ba'i phyir na le'u 'di brtsams pa yin no //
translated: This chapter was composed for the purpose of understanding that.

original: 'dir nad rnams gzhi med par ni ji ltar yang shes par mi nus la /🔽de bas na nad de rnams kyi gzhir gyur pa /
analyzed: 'dir nad rnams gzhi med par ni ji ltar yang shes par mi nus la / de bas na nad de rnams kyi gzhir gyur pa /
translated: Here, the diseases cannot be understood at all without a basis.

original: lus zungs dang dri ma rnams gang yin pa de shes par bya dgos pas na /
analyzed: lus zungs dang dri ma rnams gang yin pa de shes par bya dgos pas na /
translated: Therefore, one should understand which of the body constituents and impurities serve as the basis for those diseases.

original: nad shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma @140b zad kyi zhes bya bar nges par gnas so //
analyzed: nad shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma @140b zad kyi zhes bya bar nges par gnas so //
translated: Thus, it is certain that one should not only understand the diseases.

original: de ltar na nad la sogs pa shes par bya ba de la phan pa'i le'u bshad par bya zhing bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na nad la sogs pa shes par bya ba de la phan pa'i le'u bshad par bya zhing bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the chapter on health should be explained and taught for the purpose of understanding diseases and so forth.

original: nad dang lus zungs dri ma rnams //
analyzed: nad dang lus zungs dri ma rnams //
translated: The diseases, body constituents, and impurities

original: rtag tu lus kyi rtsa ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag tu lus kyi rtsa ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is always the root of the body.

original: nad dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams ni /
analyzed: nad dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams ni /
translated: Here, the body’s humors,

original: nad dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams te /
analyzed: nad dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams te /
translated: constituents, and wastes

original: de ni rtag par dus thams cad du lus kyi rtsa bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni rtag par dus thams cad du lus kyi rtsa bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: are always, at all times, the root of the body,

original: lus ni de las byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus ni de las byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the body arises from them.

original: rtsa ba dang 'dra bas na rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang 'dra bas na rtsa ba ste /
translated: They are like a root, and so they are called roots.

original: rgyu'i gtso bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu'i gtso bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are the primary causes.🔽The body is sustained when the winds🔽that are exhalation, inhalation,🔽movement, activity, and exertion🔽and that circulate the body’s constituents well

original: de rlung dbugs 'byung dbugs rngub dang // bskyod dang las spyod shugs 'byin dang // lus zungs legs par rgyu ba dang // dbang po rnams ni gsal ba dag / mi gnod pa ni rjes 'dzin yin //
analyzed: de rlung dbugs 'byung dbugs rngub dang // bskyod dang las spyod shugs 'byin dang // lus zungs legs par rgyu ba dang // dbang po rnams ni gsal ba dag / mi gnod pa ni rjes 'dzin yin //
translated: and invigorate the faculties

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽lus de ni rlung mi gnod cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / lus de ni rlung mi gnod cing /
translated: do not harm it.

original: dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pas mnyam par gnas na lus rjes su 'dzin cing rten par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pas mnyam par gnas na lus rjes su 'dzin cing rten par byed pa yin no //
translated: The body is sustained, is supported, when the winds do not harm it and it remains in balance through the exhalation of breath, and so on.

analyzed: de la dbugs 'byung ba ni gyen du dbugs 'byin cing gtong ba'o //

analyzed: dbugs rngub ba ni dbugs sdud cing thur du 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: bskyod pa ni dbugs su bya ba thams cad la brtson zhing rtsol ba'o //

analyzed: las la spyod pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las la spyod cing 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: shugs 'byin pa ni bshang ba dang / gci ba dang rlung phyi rol tu 'byin pa'o //

analyzed: lus zungs legs par rgyu ba zhes pa ni /

analyzed: de rnams legs par rgyu ba ni mnyam par gnas shing 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: de la mnyam par rgyu ba'i gnas skabs nyid kyis de rnams rlung nyid mi gnod par 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid yin te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par 'thor zhing 'khrugs pa sdud cing bzhi bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po rnams gsal ba ste /

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po yul 'dzin pa la gsal bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po yul 'dzin pa la gsal bar gnas pa ste /

translated: One should treat it by means of a ritual that causes sweat to be produced by means of effort and so forth.🔽The bodily heat remains in its own place,

analyzed: lus kyi me drod rang gnas 'dug / cha shas lus zungs rnams la brten //
translated: and its parts depend on the body constituents.

original: de rnams 'bri zhing rab 'bar bas //
analyzed: de rnams 'bri zhing rab 'bar bas //
translated: When those decrease and blaze forth,

original: lus zungs 'phel dang zad par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: lus zungs 'phel dang zad par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la //
translated: the body constituents increase and are exhausted.

original: lus kyi me drod ces bya ba /
analyzed: lus kyi me drod ces bya ba /
translated: As for the line that goes, “The bodily heat remains in its own place,”

original: pho ba'i me drod yin la /🔽rang gnas su 'dug ces bya ba /
analyzed: pho ba'i me drod yin la / rang gnas su 'dug ces bya ba /
translated: it is the heat of the stomach.🔽As for the line that goes, “and its parts depend on the body constituents,”

original: rang gi gnas zhu ba'i @146b gnas kyi bar na 'dug pa de'i cha shas gang yin pa rnams lus zungs la brten cing gnas pa'i cha de rnams 'bri zhing nyams dmas pas dangs ma la sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams 'phel bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang gi gnas zhu ba'i @146b gnas kyi bar na 'dug pa de'i cha shas gang yin pa rnams lus zungs la brten cing gnas pa'i cha de rnams 'bri zhing nyams dmas pas dangs ma la sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams 'phel bar 'gyur la /
translated: the parts that remain in the place of digestion, which is its own place, decrease and become weak.

original: cha shas de rnams nyid rab tu 'bar zhing stobs che bar gyur bas ni lus zungs rnams zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha shas de rnams nyid rab tu 'bar zhing stobs che bar gyur bas ni lus zungs rnams zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: When those parts blaze forth and become strong, the body constituents are exhausted.

original: lus zungs dang po phyi ma ni //
analyzed: lus zungs dang po phyi ma ni //
translated: The first and last body constituents

original: rgyas byed zad pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas byed zad pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: are the increaser and the diminisher, respectively.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: lus zungs kyi dang po dangs ma zhes bya ba rgyas par gyur na de'i phyi ma khrag ces bya ba'i lus zungs rgyas par byed la /
analyzed: lus zungs kyi dang po dangs ma zhes bya ba rgyas par gyur na de'i phyi ma khrag ces bya ba'i lus zungs rgyas par byed la /
translated: The first bodily constituent, the 'nutriment', when it increases, causes the increase of the next bodily constituent, the 'blood'.

original: lus zungs kyi dangs ma zad na phyi ma khrag kyang de bzhin du zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus zungs kyi dangs ma zad na phyi ma khrag kyang de bzhin du zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the 'nutriment' of the bodily constituents is exhausted, the next, the 'blood', is also exhausted in the same way.

original: nad dang / lus zungs dang / dri ma dang / dri ma rnams kyi gnas la gnod pa'i rim pa dang / nad 'byung ba'i rim pa smras pa ni /🔽nyes 'khrugs pas ni lus zungs nyen //
analyzed: nad dang / lus zungs dang / dri ma dang / dri ma rnams kyi gnas la gnod pa'i rim pa dang / nad 'byung ba'i rim pa smras pa ni / nyes 'khrugs pas ni lus zungs nyen //
translated: The sequence of the harm to the bodily constituents, the humors, the impurities, and the locations of the impurities, and the sequence of the arising of the humors, are stated:🔽The humors harm the bodily constituents.

original: gnyi gas dri ma la gnod byed //
analyzed: gnyi gas dri ma la gnod byed //
translated: Both of them harm the impurities.

original: 'og na gnyis te mgo bor bdun //
analyzed: 'og na gnyis te mgo bor bdun //
translated: Two are below, seven are in the head.

original: bu ga dang ni rngul 'byung ba'i ;
analyzed: bu ga dang ni rngul 'byung ba'i ;
translated: The orifices and the🔽places of sweat

original: / dri ma'i gnas ni dri ma ste //
analyzed: / dri ma'i gnas ni dri ma ste //
translated: are the locations of the impurities.

original: rang rang gnas su nad skyed 'gyur //
analyzed: rang rang gnas su nad skyed 'gyur //
translated: The humors generate disease in their own locations.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: nyes pa ni rlung la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni rlung la sogs pa ste /
translated: The humors are wind and so forth.

original: de rnams 'khrugs pa ni rang gi rgyu rnams kyis ldang zhing g-yos so //
analyzed: de rnams 'khrugs pa ni rang gi rgyu rnams kyis ldang zhing g-yos so //
translated: Their disturbance is their arising and agitation by their own causes.

original: des na lus zungs bya ba dangs ma la sogs pa la nyen cing gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na lus zungs bya ba dangs ma la sogs pa la nyen cing gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the body's elements are harmed and damaged.

original: nyes pa dang lus zungs de gnyis ka 'khrugs shing g-yos pas ni dri ma la gnod par byed la /
analyzed: nyes pa dang lus zungs de gnyis ka 'khrugs shing g-yos pas ni dri ma la gnod par byed la /
translated: When both the faults and the body's elements are disturbed and agitated, they harm the impurities.

original: gnod pa dang ldan pa ni dri ma des ni dri ma'i gnas la gnod pa skyed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gnod pa dang ldan pa ni dri ma des ni dri ma'i gnas la gnod pa skyed par 'gyur na /
translated: When the impurities are harmed, they produce harm in the places of the impurities.

original: dri ma'i gnas de dag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dri ma'i gnas de dag gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are those places of the impurities?

original: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'og na gnyis te bshang ba'i lam dang gci ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'og na gnyis te bshang ba'i lam dang gci ba'i lam mo //
translated: Two are below: the path of feces and the path of urine.

original: mgo bor ni dri ma'i gnas bdun te /
analyzed: mgo bor ni dri ma'i gnas bdun te /
translated: Seven are on the head:

original: mig gnyis dang rna ba'i bu ga gnyis dang / sna'i bu ga gnyis dang / lkog ma'i bu ga gcig ste /
analyzed: mig gnyis dang rna ba'i bu ga gnyis dang / sna'i bu ga gnyis dang / lkog ma'i bu ga gcig ste /
translated: the two eyes, the two ear holes, the two nostrils, and the one hole of the throat.

original: bu ga ni bu ga'i khung bu rnams dang / de bzhin du rngul 'byung bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: bu ga ni bu ga'i khung bu rnams dang / de bzhin du rngul 'byung bar byed pa ste /
translated: The holes are the cavities of the holes, and likewise the pores that produce sweat.

original: lus thams cad du gtogs pa'i ba spu'i bu ga rnams te /
analyzed: lus thams cad du gtogs pa'i ba spu'i bu ga rnams te /
translated: They are the pores that belong to the entire body.

original: de thams cad kyang dri ma'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: de thams cad kyang dri ma'i gnas yin la /
translated: All of those are places of impurities.

original: de rnams ni gnod pa can gyi dri mas gnod pa skyed do //
analyzed: de rnams ni gnod pa can gyi dri mas gnod pa skyed do //
translated: These are the afflictions that cause harm.

original: de bas na lus zungs dang dri ma'i gnas de rnams su rang rang gi gnas pa de rnams su rang gi nad skyed cing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na lus zungs dang dri ma'i gnas de rnams su rang rang gi gnas pa de rnams su rang gi nad skyed cing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in the body, which is the abode of the constituents and the afflictions, the diseases arise and appear in their respective places.

original: de yang lus zungs rnams la nyes bas gnod pa skyed la /🔽dri ma'i @147a * //
analyzed: de yang lus zungs rnams la nyes bas gnod pa skyed la / dri ma'i @147a * //
translated: Moreover, the faults cause harm to the constituents.🔽The afflictions cause harm to the abodes of the afflictions.

original: gnas rnams su ni dri mas gnod pa bskyed nas rang rang ji lta ba'i nad rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas rnams su ni dri mas gnod pa bskyed nas rang rang ji lta ba'i nad rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the diseases arise in their respective ways.

original: de ltar nyes pa dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams rang gi las nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar nyes pa dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams rang gi las nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis bshad nas /
translated: Thus, the faults, the constituents, and the afflictions are explained in terms of their own actions and so forth.

original: da ni nyes pa dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams kyi rtsa ba /
analyzed: da ni nyes pa dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams kyi rtsa ba /
translated: Now, the root of the faults, the constituents, and the afflictions is explained.

original: lus 'di'i nyes pa dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams zad dam ma zad par gyur kyang srog dang bcas par zad par gyur la /
analyzed: lus 'di'i nyes pa dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams zad dam ma zad par gyur kyang srog dang bcas par zad par gyur la /
translated: Whether the faults, the constituents, and the afflictions of this body are exhausted or not exhausted, they are exhausted along with the life.

original: de 'phel bas srog dang bcas pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i lus gnas pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo de smras pa ni /🔽lus zungs khu ba'i mthar thug pa'i //
analyzed: de 'phel bas srog dang bcas pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i lus gnas pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo de smras pa ni / lus zungs khu ba'i mthar thug pa'i //
translated: The chief cause of the body's existence is said to be the life force, which increases by the increase of that.🔽The most powerful of the body's constituents,

original: nang nas gzi can mdangs mchog yin ;
analyzed: nang nas gzi can mdangs mchog yin ;
translated: from the pure essence to the semen, is the supreme radiance.🔽Though located in the heart, it pervades

original: / snying la gnas kyang khyab pa dang // lus ni brtan par gnas pa yin //
analyzed: / snying la gnas kyang khyab pa dang // lus ni brtan par gnas pa yin //
translated: and stabilizes the body.

original: gang zhig 'jig na des 'jig la //
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig na des 'jig la //
translated: When it is destroyed, the body is destroyed.

original: gang zhig gnas na gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: gang zhig gnas na gnas gyur pa //
translated: When it abides, the body abides.

original: gang la dngos rnams sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: gang la dngos rnams sna tshogs pa //
translated: The various things

original: lus la brten pa 'byung ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus la brten pa 'byung ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: arise in dependence on the body.

original: lus zungs dangs ma nas khu ba'i mthar thug pa rnams kyi nang na gzi can mdangs ni mchog yin te /
analyzed: lus zungs dangs ma nas khu ba'i mthar thug pa rnams kyi nang na gzi can mdangs ni mchog yin te /
translated: Among the body's constituents, from the pure essence to the semen, the most powerful is the supreme radiance.

original: shin tu snying por gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: shin tu snying por gyur pa yin la /
translated: It is the very essence.

original: de ni mdangs zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis bshad do //
analyzed: de ni mdangs zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis bshad do //
translated: The master explains that this is called radiance.

original: de bzhin du snying ga la gnas su zin kyang lus ma lus par khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying ga la gnas su zin kyang lus ma lus par khyab pa yin no //
translated: Though located in the heart, it pervades the entire body.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
translated: It is also explained in two ways:

original: thig le drug pa'i tshad dang khyab par byed de //
analyzed: thig le drug pa'i tshad dang khyab par byed de //
translated: The sixth bindu is the measure and pervader.🔽It pervades the entire body and is the sixth bindu. It is white in color, like red, and appears slightly yellow.

original: de ni lus thams cad la khyab par byed cing thig le drug pa kha dog dkar po dang / dmar po lta bu dang / cung zad ser por snang ba khyad par du snying la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni lus thams cad la khyab par byed cing thig le drug pa kha dog dkar po dang / dmar po lta bu dang / cung zad ser por snang ba khyad par du snying la gnas pa yin no //
translated: It is located in the heart.

original: de yang lus ni brtan par gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang lus ni brtan par gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said that the body is stabilized.

original: de ni lus brtan par gnas pa dang / de bsrung zhing gnas par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni lus brtan par gnas pa dang / de bsrung zhing gnas par byed pa yin te /
translated: It stabilizes and protects the body.

original: de lus gnas shing 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lus gnas shing 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: It stabilizes and places the body.

original: gzhan yang gang zhig 'jig cing med par gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zhig 'jig cing med par gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if something is destroyed and becomes nonexistent,

original: nges par gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nges par gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur la /
translated: it will definitely and without doubt be destroyed.

original: de bzhin du mdangs gang zhig gnas shing yod par gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdangs gang zhig gnas shing yod par gyur na /
translated: Similarly, if the radiance is present and exists,🔽the person will be present and alive.

original: skyes bu de gnas shing 'tsho bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du mdangs gang las dngos po'i ngo bo rnams rnam pa du mar 'byung zhing snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: skyes bu de gnas shing 'tsho bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du mdangs gang las dngos po'i ngo bo rnams rnam pa du mar 'byung zhing snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: In the same way, the radiance from which the entities appear in many ways will be present.

original: lus la sogs pa sna tshogs par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing brten pa de ni mdangs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa sna tshogs par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing brten pa de ni mdangs zhes bya'o //
translated: The radiance that arises in various ways, such as in the body, is called “vitality.”

original: de yang bsdus pa las /
analyzed: de yang bsdus pa las /
translated: The Condensed Tantra states:

original: 'byung ba kun gyi mdangs gang yin //
analyzed: 'byung ba kun gyi mdangs gang yin //
translated: Vitality is the radiance of all the elements.

original: gzi can de ni mchog tu bshad //
analyzed: gzi can de ni mchog tu bshad //
translated: It is said to be the most important of the vital essences.🔽It is the nature of the moon,

original: de @147b ni zla ba'i rang bzhin dag / dmar zhing cung zhig ser dang bcas //
analyzed: de @147b ni zla ba'i rang bzhin dag / dmar zhing cung zhig ser dang bcas //
translated: red and slightly yellow.

original: dang po mngal gyi snying po gang //
analyzed: dang po mngal gyi snying po gang //
translated: It is the first essence of the womb,

original: gang de mngal gyi dangs mar gnas //
analyzed: gang de mngal gyi dangs mar gnas //
translated: that which abides as the essence of the womb.

original: snying ni chags par gyur pa na //
analyzed: snying ni chags par gyur pa na //
translated: When the heart is formed,

original: gang zhig sngon chad brten gyur cing //
analyzed: gang zhig sngon chad brten gyur cing //
translated: that which has previously been supported🔽and the essence of the body’s oils

original: lus kyi dangs ma snum dag dang // srog ni gang la brten gyur la //
analyzed: lus kyi dangs ma snum dag dang // srog ni gang la brten gyur la //
translated: and that upon which life is based

original: gang zhig 'jigs pas 'jig 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gang zhig 'jigs pas 'jig 'gyur zhing //
translated: is destroyed by fear.

original: gang gis lus can 'tsho byed la //
analyzed: gang gis lus can 'tsho byed la //
translated: That which sustains embodied beings

original: snying la gnas kyang khyab gyur gang //
analyzed: snying la gnas kyang khyab gyur gang //
translated: and that which, though residing in the heart, pervades

original: de ni srog gi gnas mchog yin //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni srog gi gnas mchog yin // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: is the supreme abode of life.

original: mdangs ni sems 'khrugs bkres sems las //
analyzed: mdangs ni sems 'khrugs bkres sems las //
translated: Vitality is exhausted by mental disturbance, hunger,

original: mya ngan ngal la sogs pas zad //
analyzed: mya ngan ngal la sogs pas zad //
translated: sorrow, fatigue, and so on.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The term and so on includes destruction and so forth.

original: mdangs de ni sems byung 'khrugs pa la sogs pas zad par 'gyur te sems 'khrugs pa ni khros pa'o //
analyzed: mdangs de ni sems byung 'khrugs pa la sogs pas zad par 'gyur te sems 'khrugs pa ni khros pa'o //
translated: That luster is exhausted by the disturbance of the mind and so forth. The disturbance of the mind is anger.

original: bkres pa ni shin tu mi bzad par brub tsha ba'o //
analyzed: bkres pa ni shin tu mi bzad par brub tsha ba'o //
translated: Hunger is the unbearable burning.

original: sems las ni yul rnam pa du ma la dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: sems las ni yul rnam pa du ma la dpyod pa'o //
translated: The mind is the investigation of many kinds of objects.

original: mya ngan ni sems kyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mya ngan ni sems kyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Sorrow is mental suffering.

original: ngal ba ni lus nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: ngal ba ni lus nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Fatigue is physical affliction.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jig pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jig pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The term 'and so on' includes destruction and so forth.

original: de zad sdangs shing lus rid la //
analyzed: de zad sdangs shing lus rid la //
translated: When that is exhausted, one is frightened, the body is emaciated,

original: yang yang sems shing dbang po nyams //
analyzed: yang yang sems shing dbang po nyams //
translated: one thinks again and again, and the faculties deteriorate.

original: gzi nyams rtsub dang yid mi dga' //
analyzed: gzi nyams rtsub dang yid mi dga' //
translated: Luster diminishes, one becomes rough, and the mind is unhappy.

original: nyam chung bar ni 'gyur ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyam chung bar ni 'gyur ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One becomes weak.

original: mdangs de zad cing nyams par gyur na mi sdangs pa ste /
analyzed: mdangs de zad cing nyams par gyur na mi sdangs pa ste /
translated: Here, when that luster is exhausted and diminished, one is frightened,

original: glo bur du skrag pa dang bcas par 'gyur ;
analyzed: glo bur du skrag pa dang bcas par 'gyur ;
translated: suddenly with fear.

original: de bzhin du lus rid cing me stobs chung ba dang / yang dang yang du sems shing dpyod pa la brtson par gyur pa dang / dbang po thams cad nyams shing sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus rid cing me stobs chung ba dang / yang dang yang du sems shing dpyod pa la brtson par gyur pa dang / dbang po thams cad nyams shing sdug bsngal la /
translated: one is constantly thinking and striving to analyze, and all the faculties decline and one suffers.

original: myo myo por nus pa chung bar 'gyur ba dang / gzi byin nyams shing skya bo 'od 'od por 'gyur ba dang / rtsub pa ste pags pa la sogs pa snum med pa dang / yid mi dga' zhing sems kyi mdud pa'i shas che bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: myo myo por nus pa chung bar 'gyur ba dang / gzi byin nyams shing skya bo 'od 'od por 'gyur ba dang / rtsub pa ste pags pa la sogs pa snum med pa dang / yid mi dga' zhing sems kyi mdud pa'i shas che bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: One becomes confused and weak, one's splendor declines and one becomes pale and emaciated, one becomes rough, that is, the skin and so on are not smooth, one becomes unhappy and one's mental knots increase.

original: nyam chung ba ste lus zungs rnams zad cing 'bri bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nyam chung ba ste lus zungs rnams zad cing 'bri bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: One becomes weak, that is, the body's constituents are exhausted and diminish.

original: 'tsho byed sman dang 'o ma dang // sha khu la sogs de'i sman yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'tsho byed sman dang 'o ma dang // sha khu la sogs de'i sman yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: Jīvaka, medicine, milk, meat soup and so on are its medicine.

original: mdangs zad pa de'i sman ni dzi ban ti dang / nye'u shing la sogs pa 'tsho byed kyi sman rnams dang / de bzhin du 'o ma dang / sha'i khu ba dang / sogs pa'i sgras brtas par byed pa'i sman rgun 'brum la sogs pa'i sman mngar ba'i sde tshan las bstan pa rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: mdangs zad pa de'i sman ni dzi ban ti dang / nye'u shing la sogs pa 'tsho byed kyi sman rnams dang / de bzhin du 'o ma dang / sha'i khu ba dang / sogs pa'i sgras brtas par byed pa'i sman rgun 'brum la sogs pa'i sman mngar ba'i sde tshan las bstan pa rnams bsdus te /
translated: The term “and so on” includes medicines that nourish, such as grapes and so on, which are taught in the sweet category of medicine.

original: de dag kyang de'i sman yin no //🔽'o ma yang 'tsho byed @148a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang de'i sman yin no // 'o ma yang 'tsho byed @148a * //
translated: These are also medicines for that.

original: yin pas / 'tsho byed kyi sman gyi sde tshan gyi nang du gtogs na /
analyzed: yin pas / 'tsho byed kyi sman gyi sde tshan gyi nang du gtogs na /
translated: Milk is also a medicine for life, so it is included in the category of medicines for life.

original: ci'i phyir logs shig tu smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir logs shig tu smos she na /
translated: Why is it mentioned separately?

original: 'o ma ni der sman gyi mchog yin pas khyad par du smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o ma ni der sman gyi mchog yin pas khyad par du smos pa yin no //
translated: Milk is the supreme medicine for that, so it is mentioned separately.

original: zad pa dang 'phel ba dag ni sman mdor bsdus te smras pa ni /
analyzed: zad pa dang 'phel ba dag ni sman mdor bsdus te smras pa ni /
translated: The exhaustion and increase of the humors are summarized in the following verse:

original: zas gang mi 'dod gang zhig slong //
analyzed: zas gang mi 'dod gang zhig slong //
translated: What food is undesirable and what is requested?

original: de la mi 'phrod 'phrod pa ni //
analyzed: de la mi 'phrod 'phrod pa ni //
translated: What is unwholesome and what is wholesome?🔽What is to be abandoned and what is to be given?

original: spang dang sbyin par bya ba dag / de dang des 'phel zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: spang dang sbyin par bya ba dag / de dang des 'phel zad par 'gyur //
translated: By that, the humors increase and decrease.

original: gang gi phyir rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa dag ni phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i zas kyis yul de la sred cing dga' ba skyed par byed la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa dag ni phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i zas kyis yul de la sred cing dga' ba skyed par byed la /
translated: Because the faults of wind, etc., are generated by food that is contrary to them, and they generate craving and delight in that object.

original: de yang phal cher te thams cad du ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang phal cher te thams cad du ma yin no //
translated: And that is mostly, not always.

original: zad pa ni zas kyi ris su gtogs pa dang cha 'dra zhing mthun pa'i yon tan gyis yul de sred pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: zad pa ni zas kyi ris su gtogs pa dang cha 'dra zhing mthun pa'i yon tan gyis yul de sred pa skyed par byed de /
translated: The exhaustion of wind, etc., generates craving for that object through qualities that are similar to and compatible with the type of food.

original: ji srid rlung 'phel ba ni /
analyzed: ji srid rlung 'phel ba ni /
translated: As long as the wind increases,

original: zas snum pa dang / skyur ba dang / mngar ba la dga' ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zas snum pa dang / skyur ba dang / mngar ba la dga' ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: it generates a liking for oily, sour, and sweet foods.

original: mkhris pa 'phel bas grang ba dang bsil ba'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa 'phel bas grang ba dang bsil ba'o //
translated: When bile increases, it generates a liking for cold and cool things.

original: bad kan 'phel ba ni kha ba dang rtsub pa la sred pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bad kan 'phel ba ni kha ba dang rtsub pa la sred pa skyed par byed do //
translated: When phlegm increases, it generates a liking for bitter and rough things.

original: de la zad pa la rlung zad pas snum pa dang lan tshva'o //
analyzed: de la zad pa la rlung zad pas snum pa dang lan tshva'o //
translated: Therein, the exhaustion of wind generates a liking for oily and salty foods.

original: mkhris pa zad pas ni skyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa zad pas ni skyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of bile generates a liking for sour, etc.

original: bad kan zad pas ni zas snum pa dang / mngar ba la sogs pa la dga' ba skyed par byed pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin nam chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: bad kan zad pas ni zas snum pa dang / mngar ba la sogs pa la dga' ba skyed par byed pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin nam chos nyid yin no //
translated: The exhaustion of phlegm causes the generation of a liking for oily, sweet, and so on, foods. This is the nature of things, or the nature of reality.

original: de lta bu'i nyes pa'i rang bzhin ni sman pa mi mkhas shing ;
analyzed: de lta bu'i nyes pa'i rang bzhin ni sman pa mi mkhas shing ;
translated: The nature of such faults is not known by an unskilled physician,

original: shes rab chung bas mi shes shing yul de'i rang bzhin shes pa de la mi skye'o //
analyzed: shes rab chung bas mi shes shing yul de'i rang bzhin shes pa de la mi skye'o //
translated: and one who has little wisdom. It does not arise in one who knows the nature of that country.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yang mtshan nyid gzhan dag mdor bsdus te smras pa ni /
analyzed: yang mtshan nyid gzhan dag mdor bsdus te smras pa ni /
translated: Again, having summarized the other characteristics, it is said:

original: ci bzhin stobs dang rang ji bzhin //
analyzed: ci bzhin stobs dang rang ji bzhin //
translated: As is the strength, as is one’s own nature,

original: 'phel na nyes pa rgyas par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'phel na nyes pa rgyas par 'gyur //
translated: if it increases, the fault will spread.

original: zad pas rang bzhin 'dor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: zad pas rang bzhin 'dor bar 'gyur //
translated: If it is exhausted, it will lose its nature.

original: mnyam na @148b rang gi las rnams byed //
analyzed: mnyam na @148b rang gi las rnams byed //
translated: If it is equal, it will perform its own function.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: nad dang nyes pa rnams kyi stobs ci lta ba dang / rang gi rang bzhin ci lta ba las tshad las 'phel bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: nad dang nyes pa rnams kyi stobs ci lta ba dang / rang gi rang bzhin ci lta ba las tshad las 'phel bar gyur na ni /
translated: from the strength of the disease and faults, and from one’s own nature, if it increases beyond measure,

original: nyes pa rgyas shing skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyes pa rgyas shing skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: the fault will spread and arise.

original: de bzhin du zad pa ste rang gi stobs ji lta ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu ci lta ba dang / rang gi rang bzhin rtsub pa dang / dro ba dang snum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ci lta ba zad pa las ni nad de rnams rang gi mtshan nyid 'dor zhing spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du zad pa ste rang gi stobs ji lta ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu ci lta ba dang / rang gi rang bzhin rtsub pa dang / dro ba dang snum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ci lta ba zad pa las ni nad de rnams rang gi mtshan nyid 'dor zhing spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then those diseases abandon their characteristics and are eliminated.

original: gang gi tshe nyes pa de rnams mnyam pa ste 'phel ba yang med la zad pa yang med pa de'i tshe ni rang gi tshad dang ldan par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyes pa de rnams mnyam pa ste 'phel ba yang med la zad pa yang med pa de'i tshe ni rang gi tshad dang ldan par gnas pa yin te /
translated: When those faults are equal, that is, when they neither increase nor diminish, then they abide in their own measure.

original: de'i tshe na ni mnyam zhing mi 'gyur bar gnas pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de'i tshe na ni mnyam zhing mi 'gyur bar gnas pa nyid kyis na /
translated: At that time, they abide in equilibrium and stability.

original: rang gi las nad la sogs pa'i tshul shes par bya ba las bshad pa /
analyzed: rang gi las nad la sogs pa'i tshul shes par bya ba las bshad pa /
translated: The functions of the humors and so on are to be understood from the explanation of their nature and so forth in the Caraka Treatise.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs dbyung ba la sogs pa'i las de rnams byed cing skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs dbyung ba la sogs pa'i las de rnams byed cing skyed pa yin no //
translated: Those functions, such as inhalation and exhalation, are performed and produced by the humors.

original: mtshan nyid des na de rnams mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid des na de rnams mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they are equal and unchanging due to that characteristic.

original: nyes pa zad pa rnams ni lus la nyes pa ci yang skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: nyes pa zad pa rnams ni lus la nyes pa ci yang skyed par mi byed de /
translated: For those whose faults have been exhausted, the body does not produce any faults at all.

original: mi ldang ba'i phyir dang / nus pa zad pa'i phyir dang / ci yang mi byed pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa ci yang skyed par mi byed do snyam du sems nas /🔽sman pa dag nyes pa zad pa 'phel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi ldang ba'i phyir dang / nus pa zad pa'i phyir dang / ci yang mi byed pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa ci yang skyed par mi byed do snyam du sems nas / sman pa dag nyes pa zad pa 'phel ba'i phyir /
translated: Thinking that it does not produce any faults because it does not arise, because its ability has been exhausted, and because it does nothing at all,🔽the physician never applies himself to giving food to those whose faults have been exhausted in order to increase them.

original: bza' ba dag ster bar byed pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni nam yang ma gyur cig snyam nas smras pa ni /
analyzed: bza' ba dag ster bar byed pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni nam yang ma gyur cig snyam nas smras pa ni /
translated: Thinking, “May it never be so!” he says:

original: gang zhig mnyam pas lus 'di 'phel bar byed //
analyzed: gang zhig mnyam pas lus 'di 'phel bar byed //
translated: “That which equally increases this body

original: nyes pa de nyid mi mnyam gsod par byed //
analyzed: nyes pa de nyid mi mnyam gsod par byed //
translated: kills that very fault through inequality.

original: de bas zad pa'ang 'phel ba lta bu ni //
analyzed: de bas zad pa'ang 'phel ba lta bu ni //
translated: Therefore, even that which seems to increase when exhausted

original: phan pa'i spyod pa nyid kyis bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: phan pa'i spyod pa nyid kyis bsrung bar bya //
translated: should be protected by the very conduct of benefit.”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what he says.

original: nyes pa gang zhig mnyam zhing snyoms par gyur pas lus 'phel bar byed pa'i don du 'gyur te rang gi tshad dang ldan par gnas pa ni lus mnyam pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa gang zhig mnyam zhing snyoms par gyur pas lus 'phel bar byed pa'i don du 'gyur te rang gi tshad dang ldan par gnas pa ni lus mnyam pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the fault? It is that the body grows when the humors are in balance. When they are in their proper measure, they are the cause of a balanced body.

original: nyes pa de nyid mi mnyam zhing rang gi tshad las lhag pa'am chad par gyur na lus gsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa de nyid mi mnyam zhing rang gi tshad las lhag pa'am chad par gyur na lus gsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But when those humors are unbalanced, either in excess or in deficiency, the body dies.

original: gang gi phyir nyes pa mnyam pa ni lus 'phel ba'i rgyu yin la ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyes pa mnyam pa ni lus 'phel ba'i rgyu yin la ;
translated: Because a balance of the humors is the cause of the body’s growth,

original: mi mnyam pa ni lus gsod pa'i rgyu yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni lus gsod pa'i rgyu yin pa de bas na /
translated: and an imbalance is the cause of the body’s death.
